text:
After scheduling an appointment to occur between a designated 4 hour time span, I offered for the technician.plumber to attend to a problem closer to his current location. While he cannot help that he encountered a mess and that it was me who invited him to out my appointment off til later, I never heard back from him as promised. When I reached out to their office receptionist/customer service specialist, they apologized but did not offer me a "make-up" appointment. Rather, they indicated they were scheduling people (customers calling after my missed appointment) already into the following Tuesday and it would be after that date. They told me they had been scheduling others since my appointment and it would be 2-3 days before they could work me back in. I would rather bail buckets of water to my back porch for the rest of the week than do business with a company that accepts this as customer service. Thus, I cancelled my interest in following through with the repairs. There was also an issue with price discrepancy. The web listed free estimates. It seemed reasonable however they would charge $60.00 to come from the Gadsden to Leeds area but the technician indicated it would be $89.00. He did offer to honor the price but it was dishonored by not showing up or calling. It is of course unclear if this was the intent. I will say they were all very nice if you just want to talk to nice and seemingly knowledgeable people about plumbing.

Addendum: "I see that a reply has been offered by the owner, "I'm sorry, call and we will make it right" Before spending more time talking about the idea of services, I would need to know how this would be made right. For instance, if I have received the repairs elsewhere (since this was well over a month ago), will I receive some reimbursement for such? I cannot imagine someone being so generous as to do such a thing.
Or if I have not had the repairs done, will I receive an offer no one could possibly refuse in exchange for the prior bad service. Maybe if I have an idea about whether the call is worthwhile vs a pre-scripted customer service response, I might call. Thanks for responding though.

resp.text: We are sorry for the misunderstanding. Please give us a call & we will make it right! Thank you.

name: N. Alan White
text:
DO NOT HIRE THIS COMPANY! They were hired to connect a trailer to septic after the trailer was moved.  None of the "drops"  were connected.  Both toilets drained on the ground. The sinks drained on the ground. No one can figure out what they actually connected to, but they did connect something to the septic tank. It may be the electrical conduit, but it certainly is NOT plumbing that the septic line is connected! The entire system will have to be redone. Thousands of dollars wasted. Two different companies said this job was improperly done, and that we should try to get our money back.
REPLY TO reply: BEFORE you bid the job and were hired,  it was explained to your technician what work needed to be done by a professional that moved Mobile Homes and knew what needed to be done.  His advise was ignored.  The reason I lifted the STOP PAYMENT on the check was on the council  of an attorney, who explained that by signing your document without truly understanding that the job on the contract was NOT the job I  had hired you to do, I was now legally bound. I should have known when you threatened to bill my elderly mother-in-law for a "FREE ESTIMATE",  I was making a mistake. I will be contacting the Better Business Bureau to see if they can warn others about your Ultimate "Plumbing" and Septic Services, sir, and, unlike you, am a man of my word.

resp.text:
Sir, you moved a trailer that had no plumbing. There is plastic underneath the trailer with a plumbing connection. You hired us to run a main line from the trailer to the septic tank. You didn’t hire us to repipe the trailer. After the job was completed you called us back to tell us that you also wanted us to repipe the trailer. We offered to come back and do that but it wasn’t within the price of the job we already done. On our invoice we wrote down all that needed to be done. We stated that all we done was run a main line from the trailer to the tank. We are sorry for the misunderstanding & if you would please give us a call we would love to make things right. Thank you!

Reply: Your mother wanted us to come out and run a new line from the house to the tank. We came out at 8pm & stayed for 2 hours trying to find the tank. We brought our equipment to complete the job. After we done that she wanted to wait so we charged her $60. We are sorry you think that is over priced. Thank you.

resp.text:
I reviewed your invoice from 12-5-2019. You were given 2 options.

Option A: Install 180ft of field lines.
Option B: Install an aerator

You chose the aerator for financial reasons. We offered to take 50% off of the price. On the invoice you signed it says customers choice. As we discussed on 12-5-2019 your field lines were in bad shape & this aerator would only give you a little more life. It helped for 10 months which was about the estimated life we predicted they would last until you decided to replace the lines. I’m sorry about your experience ma’am & if you give us a call we would be more than happy to come back out and help. Thank you ma’am!

text: Bobby and Charles replaced our old leaky hall bathroom faucet.Installed new faucet very professional and courteous. Would recommend them if you need great plumbers.

name: Michael Jones
text:
Nice guys with the estimate. Made sense in their explanation. We had had several companies come by. Set a date. Called several times the morning of the appointment. Finally got a call back from the tech around 10.  Said he couldn’t get to it that day, too busy. Hopefully the next week. Called someone else. Came that day. Installed both new gas lines and regulators. Nice , clean,  professional and $350 less expensive.

I should point out that I cannot judge the quality of their work. All  other reviews indicate they are good at what they do. Their inability to not show without notice was the cause for my low review. We had family plans related to their work.

resp.text: We regret that we could not get to you last week on Thursday, the day you scheduled for, and that you elected to go with another company. That day all of our plumbers except for the one assigned to do the work at your home already had very time sensitive, pressing, all day jobs that were presceduled to get started on early in the morning. Although the plumber assigned to you was called out to an emergency job early that morning we still had every intention of having him still come out to install your regulators and the extra line for your home as planned for that day. It wasnt until the morning started to progress forward in time that he realized he would not be able to get to you as planned due to him still diligently working to restore water at an elderly lady's home where she called very early that morning and said she had been without water since the day before so we had him rush right over. It was around mid morning at the time that he realized he wouldn't be able to make it to you as planned and we had to make the decision to attempt to reschedule with you since her emergency took presidence. Each and every customer and each job is truly important to us, we care greatly about the work that we do, our customers and how we serve them. We take pride in striving daily for complete satisfaction with every customer so we are very sorry to hear about your dissatisfaction. Sometimes there are circumstances and emergency situations that arise out of our control to where we may not be able to stick to our schedule as planned. Normally in a situation like that we would have just had one of our other plumbers come out that day in his place but each of them on that specific day were already on very pressing jobs that would take all day. That was a rare occasion but again sometimes there are circumstances that arise out of control to where true emergencies take presidence. Under these circumstances I do not think a two star review is warranted in this situation considering we gave you a free estimate, you called us back a couple weeks later after getting multiple other estimates from other companies to schedule a day for us to do the work at your home and we were unfortunately not able to get to it that day due to the circumstances listed above so we attempted to reschedule. The attempt was denied which resulted in us not performing any work at your residence. Again, we are so sorry if you were inconvenienced, we would love to speak with you more about this matter. Please reach out to us at info@allstarplumbs.com

name: Evangeline Smith
text:
Called Home Advisors for plumber after debacle with local plumber Teds. AllStar gave me a price for installing pressure regular that was 1/2 Teds, 250.00. That went ok.
I then asked them to fix tub faucet leak. They replaced some parts, charged me 130.00 & the leak was dry for ONE DAY. When they returned after my call, they again took the mechanism apart, showed me a "bent part" .
I have no way of knowing if they bent it on the initial try, or if as they intemated, it was done by Teds. Then quoted me a price of an ADDITIONAL 350.00 to fix this leak. No offer to try & fix it without further charge since they didn't fix it the first time either! I declined.
I have now spent 605.00, and still have the tub faucet leak, &am still waiting for my "senior citizen discount". Don't be fooled. Home Advisor is not the answer.

resp.text:
We are very sorry to hear that you are not pleased with your experience. However, our recollection of events is a bit different. We initially arrived to install a pressure regulator at a rate that was half what you had been quoted by our competitors. We complete this work and you were seemingly satisfied! You then informed us that your nearly 60 year old shower faucet was leaking so we agreed to attempt to fix it as after you denied the price quoted  to replace it 350$. We replaced all parts that are available for your particular faucet. Then on an additional visit in an attempt to try our best to ensure complete customer satisfaction we proceeded to replace the same parts again for free (we purchased the new parts and did not charge any labor and did not charge you for the purchase of the parts) because we thought they may have been defective. It ended up being that it was not defective parts,  the leak was due to it being an almost 60 year old shower faucet.   Our total cost in parts at this point is over $60 however we still honored the original price quoted and informed you that the you needed a new faucet that we would purchase and replace the old one with for $350 . You responded that the next homeowner would have to deal with that issue. You paid and we were on our way. Since
you posted this review we have attempted to reach out to you multiple times and you have ignored us and tried to chargeback the entire 130$. We strive for complete customer satisfaction but sometimes we may fall short due to circumstances out of our control. However,  we attempted to contact you to no avail. Again we will still be glad to attempt to come to a resolution but communication is vital. We hope to hear back from you soon.

name: Amy Leigh Strickland
text:
On Monday, June 8, I called Lovelady plumbing because we needed a plumber to come out and snake the drain from our AC unit to the outdoor pipe. I spoke to the manager on the phone about exactly what I needed done and she quoted me a price. I scheduled an appointment for the next day. Two plumbers came out, climbed into my attic, blew in the pipe, told me they didn't have the tool for the job, said the pipe was clear, charged me $95, and left. They also gave me some line about how an AC unit isn't supposed to produce condensation, which 6th grade science would tell you is wrong: when you take humid, hot air and cool it, water must come out.

The next day we realized the AC had kicked off again and went up to find the pan full and the pipe not draining. My husband called the main number to complain and left his phone number, requesting a phone call, but the plumber called me back on my number. My husband spent ten minutes talking to the plumber, who insisted that the pipe was unclogged (despite the fact that we could see it was clogged and not draining). The plumber was pushy, interruptive, and in the end we wasted $95 to have two guys look around our attic and give us an uninformed opinion on our AC unit. Had the woman on the phone just told me they couldn't do it, I would have saved nearly $100. They came out knowing what I expected them to do, they charged me, and they did nothing.

text: I gotta hand it to these folks! First off I am a "DIY" kinda guy but i decided to hire these folks to move a faucet in my master bathroom.  We remodeled and decided to convert the tub into a shower and needed to move the water faucet up and it was going to cost me a good bit to go out and buy the tools needed because i didnt have any just laying around. So i called every plumber from Hartselle all the way to Huntsville and these folks at George plumbing beat every one else's price by $50-$75! The day i called them they were available immediately but i was at work and they were able to come first thing the next morning.  When the two plumbers arrived they were polite kind and answered all questions i had. They were quick and let me know upfront how long it would take and what to expect. I watched the entire time as he quickly worked to move the faucet and I could tell he was a pro and not some average Joe from down the street. I highly recommend these folks and  they give free estimates. Im completely satisfied and will hire them in the future if the need arises!

text: She sounded kind over the phone. Said she would come out at 4 OR call me to reschedule for the next day. That text along with the previous call were both ignored. At 6am something this morning I get a text from her completely ignoring the fact she didn’t consider MY time at ALL yesterday and stood by me up. No apology or even mention. She was just Saying she could come at 8:30 today. I’m sorry, she may do amazing work, but I can’t hire ppl who don’t understand there’s a certain way to run a business. Communication and equal respect for one another and each other’s time is a basic MUST. I would not feel confident in making an 8:30 appointment or any other appointment with someone who has been a no show.

name: Adam Grinfield
text: Attempted to use this company but they never showed up or called to tell me they were not coming. Was told by intake on Friday that a plumber would be out between 4pm and 6pm. They never showed. Called after hours and left multiple messages for the on call person. Never received a call back. Called Saturday morning and spoke with someone (not gonna use his name) in the office and was told they had an emergency last night and he is so sorry that no one called. I understand emergencies. He then told me someone would be out this afternoon and that they would be calling me back within an hour to let me know a time. Two hours later no call. I called them back and he decided that he wanted to be nasty over the phone and apparently didn’t remember telling me they would call me back. He then suggested that I go with another company. That’s bad business. Hopefully the person I spoke with can learn how to be respectful over the phone and how to talk to clients who are helping keep your doors open.

name: Claire Bourn
text: Excellent service, technician was extremely nice and knowledgeable! Will definitely use again, thank you John!

name: Ashlea Franco
text: Exceptional service! John S. quickly diagnosed our leak and did not leave until everything was repaired and back to exactly how he found it. He was knowledgeable and professional and exceeded our expectations. He did not have all the parts needed to fix our issue but left and came back the same day to complete the job.

name: Connor Kent
text:
Final Update:
Since their last visit, I continue to have drain issues. About once a week that water will build up in my toilet, shower, and tub and stay idle. Really wanted to rate these guys more, but can’t. My home warranty company won’t get them back either. Now I’m having to pay more money just to get someone else to come and attempt to make a repair...

Update:
Had to get this group to come out to my house two more times to address the issue. Turns out it had nothing to do with my mainline but something between my bathroom and the drain to the outside. After the last visit, all seems ok for now.

Original:
John was very professional and knowledgeable. John helped me unclog my house’s main drain line and replace a toilet wax ring. This guy has a lot of experience and was kind of enough to walk me through everything he was doing and answer my questions. Thanks John! Highly recommend this company for your plumbing needs!

name: Steve Layman
text: 100% excellent service. John S was extremely professional in conducting toilet repair at my home.  He was on-time and clear on the problem and the solution.  I would not hesitate to recommend them to someone else.

name: Joann Saltmarch
text: The workers were wonderful Cordell and Blaine were good I mean excellent in their work will use the company again.

name: Don Bornemann
text: I attempted to use Drain Blaster plumbing because my home warranty company contracts with them to provide services to there insured.  Worst experience I have ever had with a plumbing company.  I had a water leak in my under the concrete slab of my recently  purchased home.  When their plumber arrived, he recommended we call a leak detection company to locate exactly where the leak is and then have them come back for repairs.  I did this, located the leak and had a remediation company remove all my base cabinets exposing the concrete over the leak. I then called Drain Blaster.  Lady answering the phone ask my name, address, and ask me to describe the problem, told me someone would call me back and schedule time to come back.  Waited all day, no call, next day called again, same routine, my name, address, describe your problem, I'll have someone call you,  again, wait all day no one calls. Third day, call again, again same questions, name, address, problem, someone will call, by 2pm, no one calls.  I start to think that maybe its having to break up the concrete that is causing them to ignore me, so I went to Home Depot and rented a demolition hammer and chiseled and hammered out the concrete myself exposing the copper pipe and the leak.  I called Drain Blaster again, and as if I had never called, ask my name, address, etc.  I told the lady that I had removed the concrete and now only need a plumber to repair my leak.  She transferred me to the office manager, Again I explained the problem and that I had removed the concrete and that I now need a plumber. She said her husband was on his way to the office and she will let him know the situation. And let me say here, that I never raised my voice or got belligerent in any of my calls.  About an hour later I get call from the Home Warranty people saying that Drain Blaster just called them, not me, and told them they would not work on it because I had removed the concrete and they didn't want the liability.  I would not recommend using either of these companies, Republic Home Warranty or Drain Blaster Plumbing, worst customer service I have ever experienced !

name: Susanna Farmer (Owens)
text: We had a great experience with Drainblaster Plumbing! John was prompt, professional, thorough, and friendly. We will call him again for future plumbing issues!

name: Richard Turcsik
text: The sump pump in my crawl space was not working and I was put in touch with Drainblaster Plumbing through my home warranty company.  John Stephens from Drainblaster arrived head of the allotted time and provided great service!  He was very meticulous, wiping up after his footsteps so he would not leave dirt on my tile floor. When it was determined that the sump pump was malfunctioning, John immediately went to the supply house, got a new one and installed it that very afternoon. I was so pleased that the sump pump problem was fixed in a couple of hours as technicians I have used for other home problems under this warranty drag it out into a multi-week event. I was thrilled with Drainblaster Plumbing's service!!!!

name: Jennifer Little-Owen
text:
Excellent service! Professional and punctual! John S. was very professional, kind, and knew what he was doing!! It is nice to have someone who is kind to work on your home! Thank you for your service! I will use you again, if I ever have any more issues!
Jennifer Little Owen

This plumbing company is the only one contracted by our home warranty in this area, but we will be happy to use them again.

text: Donnie arrived on time and addressed our issue quickly. We appreciated the fact that he followed COVID protocols while in our home.

name: Lindsey
text: They were able to get here earlier than our original appointment because of a clog in the main line. The guy who came out, Donnie, was very professional. He had a mask on before he even got to the door, that’s a big issue we’ve had with other people helping us with our new house. My wife (this is her account) is immunocompromised so that’s super important. He is an extremely hard worker and quickly fixed all my issues, and he ensured everything was fixed before leaving. He knew we needed some part and ran and got them at the store and came back very quickly. Also just a really nice guy!

text: Donny unclogged our sewer line, quickly and neatly. Friendly, punctual, professional.

text: I was referred to Drainblaster Plumbing by my home warranty company for a garbage disposal repair. He arrived timely and got the job done professionally. I'm happy that I can finally use the second side of my sink.

name: Eddy Ortega
text:

name: Chuck Martin
text: Drainblaster was sent to my home by my home warranty company on 01-18-21 to service a blocked shower drain in my basement. Upon arrival to my home, I showed the drainblaster employee the shower drain that was clogged. I also showed the drainblaster employee an outside clean out next to our septic tank. The drainblaster employee then proceeded to open up the clean out and run a plumbing snake backwards up into our house. This did not clear the problem. The drainblaster employee then run the plumbing snake from the clean out into the septic tank. This did not clear the problem. The drainblaster employee then took the top lid off our septic tank and informed me that the tank was full and not working properly. I had just had the septic tank serviced 3 months earlier by Gable Septic Tank, Inc. I took drainbasters word that our septic tank was not operating properly and immediately called Gable Septic Tank for a new inspection. Gable Septic Tank inspected the tank on the same afternoon and found the septic tank system to have no problems and working properly. I then called and notified drainblaster that the septic system had been inspected and was found to have no problems. Drainblaster refused to come back to my home for a follow up visit. Drainblaster continued to claim the problem was the septic tank even after the new inspection. Drainblaster never attempted to clear the shower drain from the drain itself. I would never recommend this company.

name: Lee T.
text:
This company was sent to our home by Old Republic. Initially I was excited about how quickly they called to setup an appointment after receiving the work order. They arrived late the first appointment to repair a toilet that wouldn’t flush (water swirling in the bowl, older toilet).

The guys augured the toilet and got the water to flush, albeit not strong, Said the warranty company would not replace the toilet and left. Quoted me $500 to replace. They also left a brown mess all over the toilet and white tile floor.

A day later the toilet stopped flushing and nothing would go down. I submitted a request for a recall and they came out a day later (Monday). Again, late. Again, augured the toilet and it wouldn’t flush. Removed the toilet to check for clogs, didn’t see any. Augured it again. Spilled water everywhere. Reinstalled toilet, wouldn’t work. Said it needed to be replaced. Called his supervisor and said it’s not clogged and needed to be replaced. Told me they would call the warranty company and I would hear back the next day. Left a brown mess.

I did not hear back from anyone. Friday came so I finally called, was told they were in the field and would call me in an hour and a half. No call back. At about 3pm I call and it went to voicemail after two rings. I left a message. No callback.

Monday I call Old Republic who advised they will get a report from the service provider. Service provider apparently tells OR that there is a clog they cannot get to, so it’s not covered under warranty. OR asks if it’s sediment (which IS covered) and apparently they told her no. OR calls me back and says nothing they can do.

I call a local OR rep and I’m informed they will honor the warranty and for me to use a plumber of my choice. A day later a plumber comes in and immediately says there is no doubt it’s not a clog, it’s the jet that is the size of a pin hole due to rust and sediment. Didn’t take anything more than looking at it to determine that (see attached picture). Replaces toilet for half the price that was quoted to me by DB (and it’s not even a builder grade).

name: Sohail Rabbani

He could have made up a thousand things and we would not have known, but he gave a clean bill of health and identified that the leak was nothing more than air-conditioning condensation. text: If I could leave 0 stars I would. This company was scheduled through our home warranty company to come look at a plumbing issue today. They were scheduled to arrive between 8-10am. When they hadn't arrived by 9:59 and we also hadn't received a phone call, my husband decided to call for a status update. The manager with whom he spoke with was very rude. He told my husband that due to the impending inclement weather, he didn't feel comfortable sending his drivers out today. My husband told him he understood that but would have appreciated a phone call letting us know our service would be delayed. The manager then proceeded to tell my husband that if HE had bothered to watch the weather we would know that there were winter weather advisories in the area. When my husband asked when our service would be rescheduled the manager stated he didn't know because he "can't predict the weather" and then promptly hung up. This company obviously doesn't value customer service and we strongly don't recommend using them.

resp.text:
I normally don't respond but everything she said is false. I talked to her husband at 4:00 PM on Thursday.  He wanted Friday in the morning.  I told him we would have to watch the weather and see how it goes. The next morning wich was Friday we were under a winter storm warning.  He called at 9:45 am and I told him we would have to reschedule.
My plumbers safety is my first concern. The majority of business in Birmingham area closed today. I am sorry they feel this way but I made the best decision on the side of my employee's safety.

name: Sarah Melvin
text: Craig was always very nice on the phone but he continually gave us the run around, refused to call back multiple times, and lied to our home warranty company about coming out for a recall job. They came to our house 3 times for the same leak in our bathroom. One technician did a valve rebuild and our shower wouldnt shut off when we tried to use it. Lee came out and had to do another rebuild because the first had fallen apart in the wall. Lee also came out a second time to replace our pressure regulator because it was running 90 pounds of pressure instead of 60. Lee was extremely nice, answered any questions we had, and also answered or returned phone calls promptly. Unfortunately, our faucet started leaking again the day that Lee replaced the pressure regulator. Our home warranty issued another recall and Craig set an appointment and never showed up. I called multiple times and he was upset saying that our home warranty didnt pay them for the last time they came out. He wouldnt send out another technician to our home so needless to say we transferred our business to another company. The only reason this company is getting two stars from me is because of Lee. I'm very disappointed that they came out 3 times and we still have a leak in our bathroom.

resp.text: You have a leak in your bathroom because of a bad faucet. We replaced your cartridge twice with no luck. We asked your home warranty if they wanted us to replace your faucet and they said that you didn’t have that coverage . They told us not to contact you that they would contact you. We work for your home warranty and can only repair what they approve for us to do. Sorry that you feel the way you do but we did all that your home warranty would allow us to do. Thanks for your review. Craig Sparks Drainblaster Plumbing

text: My home warranty company (Old Republic) dispatched this company to fix a plumbing problem in my home. A lady called me Monday to schedule an appointment for Tuesday. The appointment was for between 8:30-10:30 am. I had to work, so my brother came to my house to wait for them. The same lady called at around 9 and said one of their technicians trucks had broken down so it would be a little later, but by 12:00. At 1:30 we still had not heard from anyone. I called the company and got a voicemail. I called the warranty company and told them to change companies. Very unprofessional.

name: Jonathan Cortis
text:
I woke up the other morning to a fan of water shooting from the side of my house worthy of a theme park display. The connection from the main line into the house has broken in the night, which meant I had shut the water off for the entire house. I contacted my Home Warranty company, HomeServe, and they assigned me a plumber. The plumbing company told me that they could make it out first thing Monday. It was Friday. I had HomeServe contact another plumber - who also couldn't make it out that day.

I contacted HomeServe again, and they went down their list, and got "meh" after "nope" until they got to Drain Blaster. Even though DB is completely on the other side of Birmingham, and were almost booked up for the day, they said yes when everyone else said know. They weren't able to finish the job before ours until nearly 8 at night, but they didn't try to reschedule. They came out anyway, made the fix, and stuck around until the glue had dried to make sure it was done right. I'd highly recommend these guys to anyone who wants the job done right.

name: Frieda Truss
text: Excellent Service

name: DiAnne Jones
text: This company was sent to me by my Old Republic  Home Protection plan.  The guy ( I refuse to call him a plumber) that came out told me my pump was incorrectly installed and the warranty was not going to cover the item.  AFTER he did the work and I paid him the extra fee, he told me the relay pump was in fact inside the  box.  I had to call another plumber out the next day as after he left my tubs and shower had gunk some up in them...disgusting!  The real plumber that came out the next day from another company said EVERY PLUMBER would have known the relay pump was inside the type machine.  Waste of $260.00 NEVER USE THEM!  They do not train their people correctly.  I called the home warranty and told them how bad this company was...what a rip off.

name: Brenden Elkins
text: Very professional on time plumbing service! Totally worth the money!

name: James Frederick
text: Great attention to customer care. The techs were extremely professional and courteous. Showed up quickly and fixed my leak. I realized it was actually leaking somewhere else, they came right back out and fixed the other leak at no extra cost. Great company operated by great people

text: Man, I couldn't be more happy with Miller plumbing. Marlon is extremely nice and helpful. 5 stars

name: Christopher Phillips
text: Extremely disappointed. Marlon came out about an upstairs tub leak that was staining our downstairs ceiling while friends were staying at our house (we live out of town). He misdiagnosed the source of the leak, which then was not fixed as a result, saying it was spindles. I paid the bill.  Several months later, I found the leak had continued and easily found the leak at a Pex junction clamp, not the spindles). I called several times for a revisit and Marlon agreed to come back out later in the week. I waited the entire week for a follow-up phone call/appointment that never came.  Another plumbing company came out within 3 hours of my call and fixed the leak in about 15 minutes.

text:
I was very unhappy with my experience with Mr. Davidson. In order to get to the pipe and fix my plumbing issue, he had to take some shelves out of the bathroom closet and cut out a big hole in the sheetrock.  This is fine and expected, however once he was finished he left the big hole and didn't put back the shelves.  He also seemed very annoyed with me and that he was in a big rush to finish.  He acted very irritated that he had to be there working because he had lots of other jobs to take care of (and kept mentioning this).  I was offended because I was a paying customer too and he had acted the same way when he came out to give me a quote.  I understand that he was busy, but he should not have overbooked himself to the point that he had to be rude to me about it.
I will say that he did correct my plumbing issue, I was just unsatisfied with the way he handled things.

text: Matt and partner came out to find, dig, and repair a main line feed to my house.  They did it in wet red clay on a cold, miserable day.  I appreciate Plumb-Tech for getting a crew out next day from my call, and I appreciate what the crew did.  Thanks a lot guys.

text: Awful,  charged my parents $1900.00 for 2 2foot pipes and they still had to call another plumbing company

name: Nick Seamon
text: I had a horrible experience with the plumbing company through my home warranty, so I decided to choose my own plumbing company to fix my plumbing problems. Couldn’t say more good things about Plumb-Tech. They listened to my issues over the phone and educated me, then got someone out that day (and gave me a two-hour window as opposed to the other company that gave me a five-hour window and the missed them both times they came out). John was the plumber assigned to my house and the lady in the office called to let me know he was running about 15 minutes behind but again was very courteous and told me what was going on and that I was next. John came and listened to my problems again and said my problems could be because of several reasons. Instead of just saying there was nothing he could do and taking my money, he began the process of elimination and quickly found the problem. He educated me again and made sure the house was put back in the order it was before he arrived. I will defiantly use Plumb-Tech again. And the great thing was that I paid them what I paid my warranty plumbing company and got a lot more out of them. The money I spent with Plumb-Tech was worth every dollar.

name: Ed Carrick
text: The guys at PlumbTech in Alabaster have consistently done a great job and at a very reasonable price.  I keep the number  handy at all times.

text: Josh came on time and fixed the leak promptly. Price was very reasonable. I will definitely use plumb tech from now on.

name: Mitchell Mount
text: Worst plumbers ever for new construction. Couldn’t even get a pipe in a wall.. spilled concrete when fixing there mistake. So much for scored floors.

name: Lisa Hayden
text:
My electric water heater began to break down so I needed to find someone to replace it.  I chose to call Plumb Tech Inc. first simply because their building is on old 31 and I passed it every time I took that route home.  When I called on Tuesday the lady who took my call was very professional and quickly answered all of my questions. I explained my needs, told her that I lived in a mobile home and offered to give her the basic information on my old water heater.  She took the information and promised me a call back from a representative named Mark. He contacted me later that same day to get some additional information on the space in which the water tank would need to be installed. After our discussion I took some pictures of the space and the old water heater and sent them to the office in an Email.
The next day Mark contacted me to inform me that he had found me a water heater and give me the cost for installation.  I approved the cost and asked when they could send someone out to install it.  I was very pleased when He informed me that they could do it that Friday at 8:00 am and quickly accepted the appointment.
On Friday Josh and Matt arrived promptly at 8 am! They did a quick review of the old tank turned off the water, shut off the power to the old tank and began the process of removing the old water tank.  They worked well together and where very efficient.  It took only about 2 1/2 hours for them to complete the installation, close up the wall and turn on the water and power.
I plan to call them for any future plumbing issue I might have and will defiantly recommend them to friends and family.

name: daisy long
text: Matt and Blake replaced a kitchen faucet for us today.  Very pleasant young men professional, knowledgable and courteous. If I need a plumber in the future, I will certainly call Plumb Tech again, very pleased with service.

name: Mitch G
text: Our family had a BIG pluming problem. We called Plumb Tech as well as a few other well established plumbers. After researching the quotes and procedures, we were giving  many options. We saved ourselves a lot of money. The job was done exactly the way it was planned. If you want it done right with no B.S call these folks. Not a big review kind of guy but if its real bad or real good then others should know. REAL GOOD!!!!!

name: Byron Landers
text: They are definitely 5-Star+!!! I had a leak in my main water line in my garage that another local plumber spent 3 days trying to solve. He came up w/ a resolution that was so puzzling (not to mention an EXPENSIVE Theory) to myself and my insurance inspector that we had to call in these guys to save the day. They immediately dismissed that opinion as "not feasible" in less than 15 minutes onsite and moved some other appts around to resolve my issue the very next day in about 3 hours at a fraction of the initial quote from the other plumber. Mark and his Team (Blake & Steven) are top notch professionals! If you are in need of a Professional Plumber in the Shelby County area, then Plumb-Tech should be your 1st and Only Call!!!

name: Joel Haskins
text: Mark and his group are some of the best around. If u got a drip, they'll getter dun

text: If you need anything related to plumbing this is the company to call

name: David Shepherd
text: I had Craftsman Plumbing come to my house to quote running a new gas line to a new gas stove in our kitchen. Josh and his helper came by as promised this week, made their inspection, & provided me pricing on the spot. I setup the work two days later. Josh and his helper came out and once they opened my ceiling up realized it would take longer than what they quoted as there was duct in the way of where they were going to run the gas line. There was no way of knowing the duct was there. They never asked for more money. They kept their word on their pricing and did a good job in the process. They didn't try to cut corners to make up for the lost time that wasn't bid in. They even skipped lunch to get the job done without delay. I appreciate that and wanted to return the favor with a good review!

name: Seth Hamby
text: Had a plumbing emergency at home while I was out of town. My wife had to handle things and Craftsman did a great job of explaining costs and making her feel comfortable. Plumber came out quickly with no hidden fees. Will definitely use them again!

text: Craftsman Plumbing was amazing with our sewer line issue.  They came out and identified the problem, provided a fair estimate and had the entire repair completed on time with all the required permits and inspections.  Highly recommend this team for all your plumbing needs!  Five stars!

name: Stuart Bailey
text: Craftsman Plumbing was referred to me.  They were very pleasant on the phone and set up a plumber the same day for a water leak.  The young man came and identified the are the leak was coming from.  Cut 2 holes in our wall which was necessary to find the leak.   We found the area where the water was coming from.  This is where it goes south.  He did nothing to repair the leak.   Said to keep and eye on the area.  Brought in no tools and his only answer was for me to buy clear silicon to seal the front of the shower.  We were charged $187.50 for the service visit to do NOTHING.  I did not need a plumbing company to tell me I had a leak.  2 ceiling and 3 walls with water damage were convincing evidence.  You don't bring in tools and at least try to tighten anything?   Called a new plumber today and found it and tightened the area.   Sure their intent is not to take care of the customer but in this case that is exactly what happened.

name: Derek Herscovici
text:
The first thing that let me know I had picked the right general contractor was Jordan Latimer’s attention to detail. Other GC’s weren’t willing to take the extra measurements, or recommend quality parts, or go the extra mile to make sure this project was done right.
When the renovation process began, he communicated the process every step of the way. He let me know where there were issues and promptly set about fixing them with almost no time lost. He helped me achieve my vision for this bathroom and shower remodel and brought in a team of specialists and experts to see it through to completion. He does nothing halfway and values your input too, instead of overriding your ideas. I have gotten to know Jordan a lot during this process, and he is not only a fabulous contractor, but a man of great heart and compassion. He understands people as well as he does home remodeling and does not skimp on either. I cannot reccomend him enough. YOU WILL NEVER NEED ANOTHER CONTRACTOR AGAIN.

resp.text: Thank you Derek! That was very kind of you to say those words. I take a lot of pride in my work and I will never take a shortcut to jeopardize the integrity of a job. It has been wonderful getting to know you and I look forward to the continuing work we have going forward from here. Once again your kind words are very much appreciated.

name: Anthony Spina
text: Jordan is a top notch contractor. He went well out of his way to make sure all of our needs were taken care of. He even fixed things we never asked him to fix at no additional cost. Jordan is a perfectionist and pays attention to every detail of his work. I would highly recommend him.

resp.text: Anthony, thank you so much for the kind words! I really enjoyed working for your great family and if you ever need us we are always here for you. Thanks again!

name: Robert Sorrells
text: Our hot water heater went out early Thursday morning.  Bob at Dependable Plumbing picked up the new Reliance natural gas hot water heater and had it installed within hours.  We've used Dependable Plumbing many times, and they are competent, dependable, reasonably priced, and they stand behind their workmanship.   If you're looking for a plumber, I highly recommend them.

name: Chris McLagan
text: Excellent services you can count on them to come almost immediately. I will not use anyone else. Price's are extremely fair.

name: John Clark
text: Great guys to do business with. Came out quick and had our drain going in no time. Good clean work for a fair price. Would recommend.

name: Amy Sherer
text: They were very kind.  Came out on a Saturday.  Handled problem quickly and efficiently.  I felt the price was very fair.  I will always call them first because they were so quick to come to my rescue!

name: Sandra Forbes
text: I don't know how to praise this company enough.  If you need a plumber I would highly recommend Dependable Plumbing.   The name of the company tells it all.  These men are dedicated to helping you..  So happy to be a customer of such a business as this.  Thanks Guys.

name: R Tidmore
text: Called Dependable at 8 AM, quickly received a return call and scheduled a same day appointment. The team arrived early in the afternoon, identified and fixed the (outside) problem within 30 minutes. Great response. Polite and  efficient team. Will certainly call them first next time we need a local plumber!

name: Matt Lee
text: You can tell they know their stuff.  They came quick when u needed them and got after it.  👍🏽

name: BrnAgn2000
text: Always friendly,  prompt & professional. They've handled our rental properties for 2 years now.  Very satisfied customers.

name: Chrissy Voight
text: Called Bob on his cell. Called back quickly. Got same day service. Mike came out and took care of all my problems. Highly Recommend this company! I will be using them again for my plumbing needs. Thank You Bob and Mike!

name: Ashley Fountaine
text: These guys are good plumbers, they crawled right under my house and explained my plumbing situation to me fully, in simple terms.

name: Craig Michael
text:
I recommend Bob Cattaneo to Everyone that NEEDS a Reliable Dependable Plumber -
that When U CALL HIM, He Returns Your Call, and Comes to Your Rescue, and Fixes the Problem. He's very Reasonable !!!!!!!! and YOU Won't Find a Better Plumber!!!!!

I rate him: 5 STARS *****

name: Debbe Shirley
text: Called Bob at 7:45 am.....he called me back to tell me he was busy  and would call  me back after 8...and he did ...came out 10ish fixed the leak and finished at 1130ish.  Excellent  service...even for a women in a panic! Highly recommend  Thanks Bob and Dan

name: Mark Fortune
text: Immediate response and was at the house within the hour of placing the call. Very affordable, would highly recommend.

name: Tammy Peck
text: Would recommend to anyone.

name: yuonna beaman
text:
Called me back fast and came out the same day to fix our tank. Mark was very fast and answered all my questions.  Thank you.

P.s. do not put wipes in Septic tank.

name: Matthew Kadin
text: Mark is amazing!  Had another company come out and couldn't even find my tank after looking for a long time.  Mark found it within 3 min of being on the property.  He was very professional and got the job done in a very timely manner.  I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!  He knows what he is doing and does it well.

name: Alan Prouty
text: Honest service. Family owned and local.  They forgot to clean septic filter when they came out last time.  Tank filled up in 7 months, so he offered to empty for free.  We'll be repeat customers for as long as we are in the area.

name: Helen Bailey
text: Awesome job !! I highly recommend this company!!

name: William Rogers
text: Mr Schoen was very prompt professional and reasonably priced. I will use for future needs and would highly recommend.

name: Suzanne Reep
text: Prompt and reasonable.  Wonderful service.  Nice local guy from Elberta.

name: Steve Pruett
text: Honest, dependable and fast service.

name: Mike Williams
text: Quick

name: Brian Kendrick
text: Do Not use this company. I had them give me a quote for a plaque heater installation and the quote was $895. ($545) with an estimate to run new gas line from meter to gas appliance and connect it with parts and labor. ($350) for a pressure test and pulling the permit. I ordered a pressure gauge online and installed it and performed a pressure test and replaced all the old pipe with new pipe myself. No leaks! Call them for a second quote and the price was $810-885. ($760) estimated to connect the gas line to the space heater which was less than 5 ft away from end cap. ($50-$125) they said will be added to the total for pulling permit and pressure test comes with the estimate. Brand new pipe alone cost more than $10. The price only dropped $10 even with me doing 85% of the work previously quoted. TRYING TO RIP PEOPLE OFF!!!!

name: Elaine Brown
text:
EXCELLENT SERVICE!!!!!

Ricky is the plumber that came into the home today. We both had concerns the repair would have been expensive and difficult. Ricky successfully completed the repair with minimal cost. He also expressed concern about the health risk the dust may have created. His professionalism and consideration are excellent.

I recommend the service this business provides!!!

name: Karl Crowson
text:
I had a great experience with C&M plumbing.   Very professional team and very fair pricing.  They replaced an older hot water heater with a new energy efficient system.  They also repaired a gas leak on our stove and installed a natural gas line to our outdoor gas grill.  They knocked out all three repairs in one morning and communicated great and treated us kindly.  Ricky the technician was very experienced and a fun guy to work with and be around.

Thank you C&M!

name: Scott Pledger
text:
C&M Plumbing are responsive and prompt.
Justin and Ricky did a great job on a small little job i had !
Came to my house prepared and planned ahead, which was very much appreciated.
Would highly recommend.

name: robby king
text: The owner of this company is the best. He is honest to his word. I have met his team and I recommend them to anyone. Thank you C & M Plumbing and Gas.

name: richard roskov
text: First class operation. Carter was very professional and went 'above and beyond'. Carter also  took the time to answer and explain any questions that arose.

name: dcasey
text:
I used C&M Plumbing on several occassions and each time they deserved a 5 star rating and a positive review.
Justin has done work for me twice at my rental property and each time his work is professional and the price is fair!  I've not had to call him back for a redo of anything! He is really that good!
Carter came to my home and did some work for me on 10-6-2016 and he is just as good as Justin (that says lot!). Carter offered us options and even said that he fixed it like he'd would have at his own home.
And that folks is the thing about C&M Plumbing, they have treated each of my small projects with the care, expertise and respect that you so seldom find.
I will do business with C&M Plumbing when ever I need their services and  I highly recommend these professionals!

resp.text: Thank you for your review. It is always a pleasure to make our customers happy. We look forward to helping you in the future.

name: John Cespedes
text: They quickly came out to swap out a dying water heater. Ricky did a great job and a clean job site. I would highly recommend them.

name: Maria Yu
text: Recently I had a major replacement work done by Roarke plumbing, the main water line leak, had to replace it! Jay and Mike came, the nicest people, I met, Jay explained clearly my options, guided me! I am happy I found the right company todo the job!

resp.text: Ms. Yu, I'm so happy you took the time to leave this review.  We were glad to assist you in your time of need.  Please know we are only a phone call away should you need us again.

name: Claire Wilson
text: Reliable, fast, fair prices, and great people. Highly recommend!

resp.text: Thank you Ms. Claire for taking the time to review us!

name: LaTraysa Carlisle
text: Very professional, reasonably price, very informative about what was needed to complete the job properly!

resp.text: You are so kind!  Thank you for your review and we look forward to serving you in the future.

name: Heather Russell
text: I called to have my toilet leak repaired and the drain pipe from the washer looked it.  They were able to fix the toilet right away.  The pipe from the washer was more detailed but they were able to fix on a 2nd visit.  The plumbers wore mask and we're professional.  Referred by my landlord.

resp.text: Hi Heather!  We appreciate you taking the time to leave us some feedback.  Unfortunately, rental properties often require pre-approval, which sometimes means a second visit is necessary to fix the problem.  If you have any questions or concerns about your experience, please call our office at 334-705-6465.  We always aim for 5-star service and we hope you'll give us a chance to assist you with plumbing needs again in the future.  Thanks!

name: JUDY GLASS
text: They did excellent work in our building. Would recommend them to anyone.

resp.text: Thank you Ms. Judy!  We appreciate you taking time to leave us a review and we appreciate your business!

name: David Carter
text: Dylan and other employees with Roarke Plumbing were incredibly helpful tackling a major plumbing repair project in our home that involved jackhammering up the slab and replacing a long run of a cast iron waste line that had failed. They gave me multiple options for how to approach the job, were sensitive to pricing, and were creative with solutions and communicated clearly with us when they ran into several unanticipated obstacles during the repair work. I would highly recommend J. Roarke Plumbing.

resp.text: Mr. Carter,  Thank you for taking time to leave us a review.  We try hard to keep the bottom dollar in mind for our customers and provide options whenever possible.  We are so pleased to hear that communication during your project went so well that you took the time to mention it in your posting, we encourage our guys to communicate as much as possible when problems or obstacles occur during any repairs we make.

name: russell brumfield
text:
I had a small water leak coming from the piping underneath my mobile home that I notice in the morning. I called them, and a few hours later they fixed the issue no problem. They Took their time and explained to me what happened and how they were going to go about fixing it. Jake and Nate (the repair men)  were very kind and professional throughout the whole process.I greatly appreciate their support and assistance.
Well recommended company!

resp.text: Thank you for leaving such a kind review about our company and about our technicians.  We are so pleased that we were able to assist you!

name: Lynne Elliott-Burgess
text: Boy did I pick the RIGHT plumbers. On time, fantastic service and accommodating! Would recommend to anyone in auburn/Opelika area!!

resp.text: Thank you so much for leaving this review!  We pride ourselves on trying to accommodate our customers whenever possible.  We appreciate your business!

name: Karen Kincey
text:
Thank you Roarke Plumbing!!
From the minute I called your business to the minute Brad and Matt left my home, every bit of professionalism!
Your friendliness, knowledge, and work ethic are #1.

resp.text: You are so kind!  Everyone at this company works hard to be professional, but honestly our crew make it look easy as it naturally comes to them in how they deal with people.  We are very proud of how our employees deals with people when they are experiencing unexpected or even planed plumbing repairs.

name: Nick Collier
text: The guys at this company are awesome. My landlord called them about some issues and they had it fixed pronto and were nice and professional.

resp.text: We appreciate you taking the time to leave such a positive review.

name: Natalie Bass
text: Pleased to the moon and back! J Roarke was the only gas plumber that was super communicative to call me back and be able to work me in within a reasonable timeline. I was initially disappointed that they charge $50 just for the estimate and don’t credit that to your bill if you move forward but the end result, I’m glad they have that $50!  They were extremely helpful when they were here and due to some miscommunications with the city, they rearranged on a Friday night with their supply warehouse and one of their plumbers to come to my house and get our gas stove hooked up so that we could cook over the weekend… He had to be here well after 6 PM. I can’t thank their team enough!

resp.text: Mrs. Bass, thank you for taking the time to leave such a positive review.  We are so pleased that everything worked out and we were happy to be of assistance.

name: Leslie Edwards
text:
So happy I chose J Roarke! I had a water line burst under our house one night. Fortunately, I had somewhere else to stay. Shut off the water to the house and started looking online for plumbers. Picked J Roarke based on their 5 star Google reviews.

I called the next morning and they said they could come out that afternoon, but ended up being able to come just a couple of hours after I called. Brad came out, assessed the issue, and fixed it quickly (even pointed out that the line was piped such that there was stress on the elbow and re-piped it correctly). He also fixed another leak I had under the house and fixed an incorrectly installed hose barb. Price was way lower than I expected as well! Will definitely use them again!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words!  We appreciate you calling us and we appreciate you taking the time to leave this wonderful review.  I will make sure to pass this along to Brad! ;-)

text: One of the most professional and dependable companies I have ever worked with.  They show up when promised, back-up their work and customer satisfaction is a top priority.  Very refreshing business.

name: Bradley Musick
text:
I recently bought an older house in Opelika.  The house had some plumbing issues after a week or two of living there, so I found these guys on the internet and decided to give them a call based off the reviews on Google.

I was very satisfied with the work done, the professionalism and their prices.  They arrived on time to do the job so I wasn't waiting around all day for someone to show up and they did the actual repairs in very timely manner.  They also gave me a quote to replace  my sewage line and then adjusted the price I paid to a lower amount because they finished the job sooner than anticipated.

I will definitely use these guys for any plumbing issues I run into in the future and will recommend them to anyone that needs a good, dependable plumber.

resp.text: We are so pleased to read about your experience with J. Roarke Plumbing Co. We truly appreciate you taking the time to review us, too. We know how important authentic customer reviews are for companies and customers alike. Referrals are the greatest compliments you can give.  So in this season of giving thanks, we’re grateful for you and all our awesome customers!

It was a relief to find a knowledgeable professional who could properly diagnose and fix the problem. No more flooding!

Highly recommend!

No call, no show. Wasted days of my time waiting on them. I'll never use or reccomend this company.

text: Replaced our water heater in a timely manner with minimal mess. Good sense of humor and overall job well done. Pending the follow up visit for final touches services were great. 10 for 10 would recommend

text: We called this company before New Year's Day to have them come out and work on our plumbing. The first time they came out the were late, but we needed someone so desperately we were ok waiting. They were unable to completely resolve our issues due to a dropped pipe. No big deal, the next day we had that fixed. We called them again to come out and fix the other half of our house. After telling us they would be there first thing in the morning, they didn't show up till late afternoon. Again the issue was not fixed . The owner told us they would be out "first thing in the morning " again. Now two days later we have not seen or heard back from them. This company is unreliable and wasted two days of our time. We will be finding another company to deal with.

text: Great service was great and quick till a problem came up with the work that was perform and several calls was made to them no response still issue not resolve having to find another way to repair the issue

text: Peter was amazing. He was very polite and on time. He was punctual and very respectful, not to mention he wore a mask upon arriving. He efficiently fixed my hot water, my leaking shower and my faucet. I’d highly recommend him to anyone needing good quality service. It’s hard to find businesses that stand by their word in these times, great to know that this company does not have that issue!

name: John Southerland
text: Josh is by far the most knowledgeable plumber I have ever dealt with. Interviewed multiple people before selecting J Henry. Josh has an incredible knowledge of how all the water systems work in and around the house, including legacy systems and current technology, where trends are headed, as well as basic repair, replace, or maintenance. He has certifications that other plumbers didn’t have, which showed us he is serious about staying current on the latest trends in various water and water heating systems. Highly recommend!

text: Plumber arrived on time and was very nice. I made the mistake of not asking how much they charge. They were recommended by a co-worker and said they were reasonable. I had 3 dripping faucets. It cost me $378!  I will never make this mistake again. Always ask for pricing. They charge by the sink, not by the hour. Unfortunately my dripping sinks were 3 separate sinks.  The last time I had a plumber in, it was $160. I feel I was gouged.  Don't make the same mistake I did!

text: J Henry Plumbing is the most knowledgeable and plumber I have experienced. He helps with maintenance and emergent issues and I have referred both friends and family to him due to my level of comfort and trust in his skills. I give my highest recommendation to Josh and his team!

name: Marrius Garth
text: This is the plumber I will use for any future issues I have. extremely professional and very knowledgeable. They were fast, and communicated well with me all the things that needed to be done. they came to my house came up with a good accurate quote. gave me a number to call in order to set up an install time the next day. I called they were out early the next morning and had the issue handled before lunch time. very pleased, and would definitely recommend this company to a friend.

name: Ted Tedder
text: Highly recommend. Came out gave a well priced estimate and completed the job in a timely manner with no issues. Top notch plumbing company.

name: Jennay Reilly
text:
I have had nothing but issues with this company. First off, I had an appointment at 8:30 a.m. on Monday, nobody showed up until after 11:00. Additionally, I have called and left multiple voicemails requesting someone call myself or my boyfriend before they send out the plumber today and have yet to receive a call or get any type of response. I have been calling since yesterday afternoon. This is extremely unprofessional, I would not recommend.

In response to your reply, Nick:

It seems you have a communication issue within your company. Yes, I did call around 12:30, but I wasnt trying to locate the plumber, I was trying to get someone to call me back before they sent anyone out to my house. Kesha told me the plumber that came out the day before hadn't mentioned anything to her about my appointment and that I wasnt even on the list. All I have gotten from your company is a list of excuses... not one person has offered any type of solution. This is terrible customer service.

resp.text:
We are terribly sorry for your experience. But because we do honest and fair work, we are covered up. This is true that we were 1:30 hr late. Which we are terribly sorry about. But our plumber told you it would be after lunch the following day to do the services and you said 1-2:00. He said yes. Today you called at 12:30 wandering where we were. I don’t know why you couldn’t reach us through on the phones  unless you were experience technical difficulties. We aim to answer our phones and attempt to be as puntual as possible. Again we appreciate you using us and are terribly sorry you had this experience. We aim to serve with excellence and we’re always looking to improve. Thanks and have blessed day

Nick Preston

name: Caroline Clark
text: The plumbers were very professional Their work area clean and were very knowledgeable excellent service I would highly recommend them .

name: Benjamin Ogden
text: In all aspects of work, Nick is not satisfied unless achieving the highest standards. Works relentlessly to improve his service, and the quality of work output.

name: Jeff Hansek
text: Nick did an excellent job and reasonably priced.

name: Anne Lewis
text: Very happy with the work Preston's Plumbing did for us.

name: Macius Darkwood
text: Wouldn't even give a call back

resp.text:
Sorry you had this experience. This doesn’t happen. We appreciate you calling us. We love our phone to ring. So this had to be a miss understanding.

Nick Preston

name: Evelyn Bates
text: Everything I needed cheaper than a smaller chain and some really great deals

name: Bobbie King
text: Always have what I need and always a pleasure!

name: Debra Vickers
text: good service

name: Alex Matson
text: Parker was quick to respond to my house once I identified my water heater was leaking. He was extremely professional and walked me through all my options and helped be make the best decision on which new water heaters to install. They worked diligently and were finished in a timely manor. Highly recommend!

name: Jennifer M.
text: Called during the 8am hour about a dripping shower tub faucet and leak from a broken knob. Said he could probably have someone out that afternoon and to text my information and a picture. Showed up and completed the job by 10:30am. No more leak, no more drip, broken knob replaced. The plumber who came out was professional and when he say I was wearing a mask - last trimester pregnant - he offered to get one out of his truck before crossing my threshold. I appreciated that. I will be calling again when the need arises. Thank you!

name: Jeremy Fehrenbacher
text: Extremely impressed with this group. Very responsive on a Sunday night & fixed the problem early Monday AM. Highly recommended

name: Cheryl Jacobs
text: Terrific service! Professional, clean, friendly. Very happy to recommend Parker and his staff.

name: Qi Wan
text: I had very good experience with this service from beginning. First of all, Parker is very responsive and prompt. Every time I contacted him, he either picked up the phone to answer or call me back very quickly to discuss the issue with me. That responsiveness is the first indication of good service. He and his buddy Bradley helped me to install the whole house filtration system I bought. Apparently they never installed this before and they read the manual and did an excellent job. In the process, it took them significant effort to remove the old system. They are prompt on time and the service was professional with excellent quality. The charge is very reasonable and fair. I will definitely use them in my future plumbing project. Highly recommended.

name: james gardner
text: Very professional and did a great job.They were on time and cleaned up after he was done. I highly recommend Old Town Plumbing!!

name: Jean Warren
text: Excellent service!  Very qualified and completed repair and provided other requested services in a timely manner. I also felt very comfortable with the repair person in our home, a very nice young man.

name: Carole Hamm
text:
Highly recommend!
Very responsive and willing to go the extra mile to solve your plumbing issues. Professional, polite, and prompt service. Thank you, Parker.

name: Helen Blue Parache
text: Installed a water heater and washing machine. Very professional and better quote than had received from others. Great communication.

name: Brighton Jones
text: This is the second time Parker has done some work for us and we’re satisfied customers again. He arrived on time, looked for the least invasive option first, cleaned up before he left, AND recommended someone to assist with the necessary drywall work. Definitely my go-to guy for plumbing work!

name: Matt Smith
text: I did not end up needing their services, but all communications and dealings with the employees were polite and efficient.

name: Kim Neighbors
text: Excellent customer service, very prompt and honest!

name: Cathy Sumner
text: They did an excellent job of switching us from two meters to one.

name: Ian Pline
text: I had Parker/Old Town Plumbing LLC unclog a drain. He was both professional and affordable.

name: Mike Crowe
text: They did a great job repairing a broken pipe in our slab.  They made an initial visit, coordinated with the leak detection company, then repaired the pipe and poured the replacement concrete.  They finished in less than a day and were very careful to avoid any extra damage to the house.  And they were responsive, friendly, and professional.

name: Amy McWilliams
text:
Parker recently repaired a shower for us, and he was wonderful.

He is professional, knowledgeable, and dependable. He showed up within the time frame that he scheduled us for and quickly diagnosed the issue. We were back up and running same day!

Also, he had a great recommendation that saved us money and solved our issue!

name: Ginny Murray
text: They were very nice and knowledgeable. They fixed a pipe on my tub and my toilet and did a great job.

name: Ryan F
text: I would definitely recommend. Parker was here right on time. Polite, professional, and knowledgeable. I won't use any other company as long as he's doing business.

name: Sarah Annerton
text: Parker was very responsive as well as knowledgeable about his craft.  The quality of workmanship was great and his communication skills can't be beat.  We are thrilled to have found him and look forward to working with him again in the future.  We definitely recommend his services to others.

name: Dina Demarco
text: Parker was responsive to my phone call for an estimate.  He completed the work timely and professionally.  Wore shoe covers to protect my home.  Everything looked great when he was complete.  Reasonably priced as well.

Great communication. Showed up on time. Very professional.

text: Highly recommend using Old Town Plumbing for any plumbing issues!! They were super professional and fixed my sink/dishwasher issues quickly and did great quality work!!

name: Stephanie Selko
text: Parker did an amazing JOB! He was honest about the cost, arrived on time when he said he would, and didn't charge a FEE to just SHOW UP!! I highly recommend  this company.

text:
Parker saved me thousands of dollars on a new tankless water heater install by simply taking the time to troubleshoot my old unit (despite another plumber pronouncing it dead). He was able to isolate the issue and bypass the part so I would have hot water while we waited for the replacement to arrive.

He is fast working, extremely professional and a joy to do business with.

name: Mary Stine
text: Parker has excellent customer service. The fact that he follows up with a call is superb to any other. Some of my friends have used him and we’re very satisfied as well. Way to go Parker!  Keep up the good work.

name: Alex Williams
text: Today Parker from Old Town Plumbing came out to repair a double clogged sink. They were awesome, on time, and took care of the issue. ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ Thank you and highly recommend!

name: Billy Smith
text: Very professional. I couldn't be more satisfied with their work. All work was completed on time and at the agreed price. I will definitely use them again.

name: Robert Berinato
text: Parker Lee showed up on time, was clean, professional, and hardworking, and even brought wipes to clean up.  He was extremely courteous and polite.  Our faucets are working great now, and we plan to use Old Town Plumbing in the future.

name: Theresa Summer
text: He was very pleasant and professional, as well as personable. We will definitely call him again for help.

name: Shaun Smith
text: Highly recommend Old Town Plumbing! Parker responds fast to phone calls, was able to do my repair the next day.  Very reasonable pricing.  Went above and beyond.  We will not hesitate to use them in the future

text: Much cheaper because of the correct assessment. Which I did not get from two other plumbing companies.

name: Ana Marie Meade
text: Service was great!! Parker take care of the problem right away...price is very reasonable as well. Thank you so much!

name: Emily Hinson
text: After finding the source of water in my crawl space (two leaking pipes), and showing me pictures of the problem areas, Parker Lee of Old Town Plumbing gave me an estimate and was able to do the repair work the next day. He was punctual and very professional. I will be calling him with future plumbing issues and will definitely refer friends to him.

name: Chris Donovan
text: Parker was fantastic and I would highly recommend him to anyone needing a plumber.  I called him at 7:30 in the morning regarding a blown ball valve. We had to cut the water off to the whole as it was flooding our crawl space. He said he would try to get out that same day. He called me at 11 and said he could work me in. He put in a new ball valve and did it at a great price.

name: Kalab Holcomb
text: Old Town Plumbing did a great job installing my new tankless gas water heater. Parker communicates very well and is always prompt getting in touch. I changed plans on him and he was very understanding and accommodating. His rate was far better than any other quote. Highly recommend for any plumbing work!!

name: Celena Birch
text: "[Service, Timeliness, Technician] Showed up way quicker than expected. I was even given a courtesy call when they were on their way. Both gentlemen were not only quick, but friendly, and professional. "

name: B B
text: Parker was very knowledgeable and professional. We have used several different plumbers but he will definitely be the only one we use now. He also gave us a military discount which was great! Highly recommend this company!

name: Charlotte Corley
text: We have a super old house, and we’ve always had two toilets that have given us trouble. Old Town came right away, and solved the problem quickly! Replaced one of our toilets, and found out that our other toilet’s pump simply wasn’t hooked up. He rehooked it and installed the new toilet super fast, and it was much more inexpensive than we expected. We will definitely be calling him for any and every need in the future!

name: Lisa Durant
text: Parker arrived on time, completed the repair in a timely manner and for a reasonable fee. I will definitely use Old Town Plumbing in the future and recommend them to others!

text: Parker Lee of Old Town Plumbing installed a toilet for us and removed the old one.  He was recommended by a neighbor. He cleaned up the area before leaving.  His price was what he quoted beforehand, which we felt was very reasonable.  We will call on him again when we need plumbing work.

Thank you so much Old Town Plumbing!

text: I called Old Town Plumbing with a few plumbing issues and they were very pleasant from the start! Parker answered the phone and asked a few questions and was able to squeeze me in the same day! He came out and completed the jobs quickly and were very reasonably priced! Great Company and I will use them again and recommend them to friends and family!!

text: I was very impressed with the quick, professional service from Old Town Plumbing. I will definitely call them again if needed and will highly recommend them to friends and family. Thanks Old Town Plumbing, for making a stressful plumbing situation so much easier than past experiences!!

name: Kristie Williams
text: I am extremely pleased with my choice to work with Old Town Plumbing. They have earned my business as well as recommendations. They were timely, respectfully of my home and extremely professional and personable. They went above and beyond with a very simple routine garbage disposal install. I'm extremely pleased. Keep up the great work! If you're looking to have work done and are reading this... look no further! Give them a call today!

name: Sonia S
text: After spending thousands of dollars for countertops, carpet, backsplash, vinyl siding............they sold me a cracked kitchen sink........I had to return it............they gave me credit for the returned sink...........but forgot to charge me for the new sink that the crew had to bring from another store.  The manager Gail hounded me about coming in to have the $199 sink charged to my Home Depot account.  She even threatened to cancel the installation of my backsplash that was scheduled for the next day.  Needless to say........I did go in and pay for the sink.  Very unprofessional.............considering I have been a loyal customer for years.

name: Wade Parnell
text: Most helpful.

name: mike piliponis
text: Quick service

name: Brad Watson
text: On the initial call, they were quick to have someone out to check our leaks and blockage. They were the only company of many that could come that day (which was important because we didn't have water). They quoted us a price (which seemed high, but as the only ones available the next morning, we agreed). The next morning comes around, and no one shows up. We call 3-4 times and cannot get anyone on the phone. No one showed up at all on the scheduled date (a Friday). So, now we have to find someone else that can come next week and be without water for at least the weekend if not longer. You'd be better off calling someone else even if they take longer to work you into their schedule.

name: Martin Breland
text: was the only plumber in the area available on short notice.  cost was $115 for a simple repair – and then another $115 because we all missed noticing a second leak, the first time.  first visit arrived 30 minutes early; second visit one of the half hours later than scheduled.  none of the locals apparently work weekends, so I was without water for three days

text: Polite careing people, gets the job done fast an right. Reasonably priced an great service. Gentlemen there r polite well manerd an hard working, they don't waist their time or urs

Will not use this service again...beware...called back for second call / w/in 1 wks time should have been addressed on 1st call...was my 1st time using this ????????  They wanted more money
not a happy customer...
