text: Made an Appt and didn’t show or call;Made another Appt showed but didn’t get back with me on price.Very Poor Values

name: Ethan Brooks
text: I like the fact that they are called 5 star plumbing. Its sad that they only have 4.8 stars so ima give them 5 stars because they do good jobs.

name: Susan Garrison
text: In Nov 2018 they replumbed my entire house in Elberta, AL and went above and beyond by also replacing my shower fixtures for just the cost of material.  In Nov 2019, one of the valves above the hot water heater separated and flooded the kitchen.  They responded promptly, replaced the valve and told me they and/or their supplier would cover the damages.  They did so with no hassle.  In March 2020, I hired them to replace the pipes in my yard.  Again, they were punctual, did a great job, and their price was lower than the other quote I received.  I highly recommend this company!

name: Steve Hartsock
text: Great people. Great service.

name: Richard Morrison
text: I have used 5 Star at my business and home for several years. Shane and his crew are professional, knowledgeable, and always on time. If you are reading reviews to pick a reliable plumbing company stop reading now , pick up the phone and call 5 Star. You will not regret making that choice.

text: Shane was very thorough and professional. We were pleased with the service and definitely keeping his number in case We need to call again for anything else!

text:
Straight up guys!
Called requesting a quick service call on a concrete job I was on. He didn't have time, however he did make time to explain how to fix it over the phone.

Thanks bud!

name: Luke Williams
text: Good, honest people to have come out and do some plumbing work at the house. I will recommend them to everyone I know and will definitely use them in any future plumbing needs.

name: Ward Williams
text: Excellent service. Informative, reasonable, professional. If I ever need a plumber again, I'll be calling 5 Starr.

name: Mike Dreyer
text: 5 Starr did a whole house repipe for us. Besides being very reasonably priced, they worked within our schedule, cleaned up the work area every day and made sure water was available at the end of each work day. The one issue that cropped up because of the layout of our house, they worked on until they resolved the issue. All within the quoted price. No hidden fees, no extra charges. Would definitely recommend them for plumbing work.

name: debra snider
text: Awsome job and done on time. Thanks guys!

name: Fred Martin
text: I highly recommend 5 Starr plumbing ‼️. Shane is prompt and honest , knows what he is doing and does it very well ‼️. I’ll recommend this young man every chance I get.

name: dirk mccall
text: Shane did a complete re-piping on our home; set a gas lamp line and put in a on-demand water heater.  Not only was everything done well, it was his pride in professionalism and genuine personality that just made writing the check easier.

name: Ellen Wallace
text: Wrong order. Chicken tenders terrible THIS IS WRONG COMPANY REVIEW

name: Annette Sebastian
text: Much to our dismay, we noticed a leak in our slab and a puddle developing in our home.  Shane responded that day to investigate.  He laid out all our options to fix the repair  up to re-plumbing the whole house.  Given that many homes in our neighborhood have been experiencing many pipe leaks and gone through the pain of redoing the pipes in the entire house, we choose to "bite the bullet" and get the whole house re-piped.   Shane and is crew did an efficient and tidy job.  The repair of the final holes for piping was completed by his referral who did a reasonable priced and very professional job.  Thank you 5 Starr Plumbing!

name: Will Faulkenberry
text: Great service and trustworthy guy!

name: Tommy Pate
text: Grwat place

name: Christina Novello
text: I wish I could say it was a good experience. But, they don't give you an appointment time, and with a job that is hard to do.  I then explained this to them, that I work an hour from home and just getting a call when they are available didn't work for me.  She did understand that and then was able to schedule me a time.  After taking time off of work and waiting, I had to call when they were over an hour late. I was informed the plumber had decided that he was taking other jobs in the morning and I would be in the afternoon.  I found this to be very unprofessional as we had an agreed upon time and I had taken time off work, I was not even given the curtesy of a call to tell me the about the change.  She was very apologetic, but I said that was disappointing and would find another plumber. She asked if I was sure because she knew all plumbers were busy and short staffed.  I called another plumber and they were here within the hour.  It is nice when a business realizes your time is just as valuable as theirs.

name: Deborah Kennedy
text: Leak in gas log line that went through wall. Carroll and Corey spent the time to find it and now we can use our fireplace. Very personable, efficient and a minimum of mess. Would definitely use them again. Thanks guys!!!

name: Jay Stembridge
text: Showed up on time, did job requested, bill matched the estimate. Just like previous times. What more can you ask for? :)

name: Kim Kerr
text: Cole Plumbing is excellent!    They repaired my sewer line that a few other plumbers had been unable to fix.  Cole actually found the problem and fixed it instead of just going for a temporary solution.  If you want something fixed right the first time, call Cole!

name: Angela Washington
text: Awesome!! Mr. Carroll was very professional and helped put my mind to ease. I will definitely be calling them again!

name: Wanda Reynolds
text: Professional and prompt.  Solved my problem in a hurry!  Thank you!

name: Mz. T. McKitt
text: Ms. Heather has great customer service skills.  She is friendly, helpful & courteous.

name: Kelvin Simpson
text: Fixed a leak under my slab in a matter of a few hours and charged me over $1200. Couple months later the leak came back and now they are too busy to come back out! Worst Quality/Customer Service I've ever experienced!!

name: Jerry Shands
text: Very knowledgeable, quick to schedule your appointment, and very affordable - definitely the best plumbing service in the River Region!

name: Chris Hutto
text: Like many of the other reviewers here, I called Cole.  I had a kitchen faucet I needed installed.  The lady on the phone told me it would be a $59 service charge whether work was done or not.  I live in a rural area, so I didn't say anything.  When they guy got there, he was VERY courteous and he was right on time.  I will give them that.  He looked at what I wanted done.  The kitchen faucet (with all the parts), and a the repair of a leaky tub faucet.  I had to sign something saying I would pay the service charge before I could even get a quote.  To install the kitchen faucet, they wanted $484!!!  Remember, I already had everything there to do the work, minus the tools.  To fix the leaky tub faucet, it was going to be another $350!!! So, yeah.  For about an hour or so of labor, we're talking nearly $900!!!  I kindly thanked him for coming out and told him we could call if we needed anything else.  I gave him the $59 and escorted him to the door.  My wife and I wound up installing the kitchen faucet later.  It took about an hour.  We had to read the instructions.  I'm thinking it would have taken the plumber about half that time, since he had tools and knowledge that we didn't have.  The tub is still leaky, but for $350, we can live with it until a rich uncle dies or something!  Cole should really re-evaluate it's prices.  I would have given them one star if the representative that came to the house was not so nice.

name: Ronaldo de Jesus
text: Prompt service. It's not cheap, but it's well worth it

name: Jermaine Watson
text: Horrible experience, I understood the $59 service fee was to come out to give an estimate of what it would cost to make the repair. That was not the case the $59 dollars was only to come to your home they wanted $342 to determine what the problem is, and another amount to repair so basically you pay the service fee to see someone. PLEASE SPEND your money elsewhere!

name: Melany Howard
text: The service from Cole Plumbing was great. The receptionist let me know that they would try to work me in yesterday and they were able too. The crew that came to the house were courteous, professional and knowledgeable. The cost was fair considering they came the same day. I will certainly use them again!

name: Margaret Traylor
text: I had a wonderful experience with Coles.  They drained and took out 2 old water heaters from my attic.  They installed a new water heater.  The price was not cheap but neither was the work.  I had gotten a 2nd estimate and it was slightly over Cole's estimate.  They came within a couple of days, did the work and the price did not increase.  They helped me complete my rebate information and get that in the mail.  They did not leave a mess in my house or yard.  I would recommend them!

name: Douglas Fischer
text: Great company. Professional, knowledgeable and friendly.

name: Shelley Wood
text: I just called their "emergency line" multiple times due to a leak. The man finally answered, didn't let me speak, yelled at me for calling him, and told me no matter what he would not be coming to my house tonight because he needed to sleep. Then he hung up. We have used Cole Plumbing in the past and have liked them, but we will not use them again.

name: Lam Jam
text: We were faced with total replacement of our copper throughout the house due to pin holes popping up everywhere.  We researched several options and finally decided to choose Cole for their spray in liner system which saved us from having to tear out and replace sheetrock in our home.  Russell and the guys (even Mr. Cole's son) did an outstanding job and I'd recommend them to anyone.

name: kimberly carter
text: The guy was nice don’t get me wrong but this company is a total f****** rip off . They wanted to charge 752.00 to snake my pipe and told me that it is not guaranteed to fix it they would have to dig this and that so I nicely declined and as soon as I did rotor rooter called me and came right on . I paid Cole’s 59.00 to come out here and tell me basically that I would just be giving them my money and it’s no guarantee it would work .Rotor Rooter is here now 175.00 and within 5mins I already see progress and he says that was overpriced and unbelievable and I agree .Please do not spend your money with this company it’s a waste I could have gave this guy the 59.00 as a tip he came right to the problem No guesssing or nothing and the price is reasonable I will most definitely never use another company besides rotor rooter .I called the company and explained what happened and the lady hung up in my face so I called back another lady answered and she’s trying to resolve the issue and said she understands but this is a rip off DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY CALL ROTOR ROOTER my plumbing is working good and he’s not even finished yet ! That speaks volumes the time the guts from Coles took just looking around this guy has my issues resolved

Made a Friday afternoon appointment, no show.  Called 2 times to find out what the status was. They kept promising they were on the way.  So, on Monday called again for afternoon appointment.  My tenant has to take off from work again.  This time they showed.

They reseated the toilet with new flange, ring and put caulk around base.  $478.00 after a 10% military discount!  For an hour or less job.  I know it was no more than $25 in material.

Outlandish cost.  I could of bought a new toilet from Lowe's and had them install it for less than that cost and had a new toilet!

name: Hannah Skinner
text: UNPROFESSIONAL, CROOKED, AND A HUGE RIP-OFF!! I GIVE THEM NO STARS. THINK TWICE BEFORE USING COLE PLUMBING!! Our hot water heater wouldnt heat; we had a plumber come to diagnose the problem. Prior to arrival, my husband called and specifically asked for the technician to call him before making any repairs. We were told that we could turn down the service and pay a $60 service fee or have them fix our hot water heater and pay for the services and have the service fee waived. After only 12 minutes, the plumber came out and said he fixed the hot water heater and that it would cost $194. All he did was reset a switch and clean the filter. After signing the invoice and paying for the service, I called my husband to make sure that the plumber called him before making repairs. My husband informed me that he received no such call. The plumber decided to fix the hot water heater without consulting with me or my husband first as to whether we wanted them to fix it or to seek service somewhere else. Carrol, who they described as a master plumber, never followed our specific instructions. We called the Cole Plumbing office and spoke to Jeanette a secretary who was extremely rude, and we asked that we could speak to Mr. Cole directly about the situation. We asked that they put our check on hold until we could get the issue resolved. After several days of not hearing from anyone, we called again. We were still unable to speak with anyone in charge and received a rude runaround from Jeannette the secretary. One month later, we received a letter from Chambless Math and Carr for a debt collection of $260.80, yet had still received no call from Cole Plumbing. I called again to see if I could speak face-to-face with Mr. Cole. James Cole said once they turn us over to the lawyer that it was out of their hands and it would be a waste of time to even come up there and see someone. No one would even hear my side of the situation. Overall, we spent $260 on a problem that would never have happened if they had followed their protocol and our specific instructions to inform us of the problems with the hot water before making any repairs. Cole Plumbing is an unprofessional and crooked company. I would not recommend their services to anyone not even my enemies. They never would hear us out and only took their plumber's word over ours. The customer was not put first. DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME AND MONEY!!

name: O'Neill Pollingue
text: Can't say enough about how responsive and effective Cole Plumbing was at fixing an after-hours call for a hot water heater spewing water out of the cold-water feed....beautiful job, professional and polite service personnel. Everything they needed was on the well-equipped truck...problem solved. Service response was surprisingly quick, customer support by direct phone with dispatcher even after normal work hours...felt that I was in good hands, and my panicky fears were completely allayed by the generous and caring team.  Many thanks!

Ms Williams,
We are so sorry to hear about this and we want to know more about your experience to try and rectify any issues you may have had with our service call. text: Jeremy and Jacob were on time, very knowledgeable about the electric issues in my home and professionally communicated quotes/services needed. name: Neil Keith
text:
We needed some work done quickly. I reached out to Aubrey on a Saturday. He worked with me over the weekend to get an estimate as well as giving me a couple days early in the following week the work could  be done. He was professional and. very helpful making me understand the work that needed to be done. Even though i called him several times, he always got back to me promptly  and professionally.

On the day the work was scheduled to be done, Jeremy and Jacob were on site early and started the job promptly. They were very courteous, professional, and prepared. They had everything they needed to finish the job and would not stop until all of the work was finished.

They cleaned everything up and provided additional contact information in case we  needed to talk to them. I have recommended them to several neighbors and certainly will use them if I need work done again.

Their pricing was great.

resp.text: Thank you Neil for the kind words! We are happy we were able to help you and make it a super experience. Thanks again!

name: Cameron Faili
text: I'm so grateful we called John's Electric and had Aubrey as our technician today! We are new to the area and needed a professional electrician to help us troubleshoot a recurring issue in the basement (which houses our water heater). We called this morning and their office staff was very helpful and allowed us to speak directly with Aubrey about the issues. He confirmed a same day appointment and was incredibly knowledgeable, honest, and helpful. Aubrey checked the specific room and closet we needed and was thorough enough to check the entire basement to ensure no other issues needed attention. His assessment was clear and honest and his recommendations included a simple, inexpensive solution. He did not try to up sale services that weren't required, and thanks to him, we now know that our electrical setup in the basement is functional and safe. We didn't spend money that we didn't need to spend. We will definitely call John's Electric, and ask for Aubrey, the next time we have a need for an honest electrician. We highly recommend them!

resp.text: Thank you Cameron! I am glad we were able to help and make it a good experience. Call us anytime!

text: Couldn't say enough good things about John's Electric. I had an emergency come up yesterday related to my power meter that needed to be addressed quickly. He addressed the problem, scheduled the appointment to come out and work with Alabama Power and did all of this within 15 hours of first talking with him. We need more kind and caring businesses like this!

resp.text: Thank you Evan! Glad we could pull you out of your jam. Call on us anytime!

John's Electric was contacted was contacted by us and Mr. Aubrey Teele returned the call. Mr. Teele asked relevant questions, discussed possible solutions, and confirmed our location. Mr Teele is very courteous, and very knowledgeable. He helped our family in such a tremendous way! We will never forget his efforts, his kindness, and the impact of the solution he brought to our lives!

text: Jerrod and Jacob did an exceptional job in adapting to a changing need on our part. They made themselves available to meet our needs at two different locations. Great job!

name: Debbie Greengard
text: Was awakened at 4:30AM by loud beeping noises coming from, what we thought, was our hardwired smoke alarm system. Made numerous calls to other area electricians that either couldn't come out immediately or had "dispatch fees" of $180 or higher. Saw the reviews for John's Electric and am so called we made the call. Jeremy and Jacob were at our home within 30 minutes. They were professional, courteous and friendly. They got right to work trying to solve the problem and quickly found that, not only was our carbon monoxide detector the issue, but our smoke detectors were way past their expiration date. Upon our request, they were back out first thing the next morning--right on time--replacing everything. So glad we made the call. They didn't try to upsell anything--even when we asked them to take a look at a few other electrical issues. Their prices were excellent for the replacements and installation and they didn't even charge us for the original emergency call. We experienced just how hard it can be to find good, honest businesses that can be trusted and that won't take advantage of anyone during emergency situations. We highly, highly recommend them and will be referring John's Electric Service to all our friends!

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words and your business!

When your wife wakes you up at 2:00 in the morning and asks you if you hear water running, you know immediately it's not going to be fun. That's exactly what happened early this morning and the leak in the basement was in fact "not fun".
I turned the water off and first thing this morning called B & C. The lady who answered the phone was super nice. She set up an appointment and told me what time the plumber should arrive. name: David Solomon
text:
For this review, I feel I must first present a little information up front.
For the last several months I have been having issues with the plumbing in my house.  My house was built in 2007 with PVC pipe throughout.  Let’s just first say that after purchasing the home I later believed the plumbing was not installed to code, and first experienced several water leaks of which I fixed myself.

Several months ago I hired a plumber to come in and resolve a hot water (lack of) issue.  The Hot water tank had made an awful screeching noise similar to what I have been hearing in my modern GE Refrigerator with a water filter. At the time the plumber removed a check valve on the water Heater which resolved my Hot water problem and the screeching noise.  No further investigation was conducted on why the Hot water heater started having issues and I believe that repair cost me around $100.00.
So in the last couple of months I have still have that screeching with my Refrigerator and the pipes had been banging whenever we flushed one of the toilets.  Upon doing some research to try and resolve the banging pipe issues I had come across an article on a thermal expansion tank upstream from the Hot Water Heater on the Cold water line.  I located mine under the house just as the main cold water line comes in the house. The tank has a valve in it and is supposed to give a cushion for the water when it expands.  I went to check the expansion tank and when I put on an air tester, water came out, which is an indication of a faulty tank.  I purchased a new one and left the air pressure at the manufacture default and installed it.  Now my pipes started banging worse and the tank started making a sucking sound. I further researched the issue and found an article that too much water pressure can wreak havoc on your water system so I went to Lowe’s and picked up a cheap home water pressure gauge. I tested my system and found that my home was averaging around 130PSI. Based on this information resources indicated that a faulty Pressure Relief Valve (PRV) just up from the home water meter could be the culprit. I located mine by digging about a foot up from the local water meter and left it uncovered.
It was finally time for me to call a plumber as I am not one, and only completed the previous steps out of necessity.  I am a retired Enlisted Veteran and have not had a real job for six years and have been struggling to pay my bills.

The day before Christmas I called B & C Plumbing Inc. and left message on their phone system that I would be needing their services when they could work me in.  Tuesday after Christmas I received a courteous phone call from the B& C customer service and scheduled a Master Plumber to arrive at my home between 14:00 – 16:00. Shortly after that Drew the Master Plumber called me from his cell phone and said he was on his way over because he had a cancellation and would come and resolve the issue.

This is where the negative experience starts.  Drew arrived at my front door knowing the information that I had already shared previously and I shared that information with him again on what my issue was going on under the house.  His first statement to me before looking at anything was that it was going to cost me $300.00. No indication of a discount for anything or because I was a Military Vet.  Now first off, I expected that he would be crawling under my home and fix some of the issues with the bagging pipes (Non-Code meeting).  He had no time to give me a run down on what the problem was nor what it the cost layout was to fix my issues.

He proceeded to place a water pressure gauge on the outside faucet and recorded that the PSI was 145. He then went to the Pressure Relief Valve (PRV) and replaced it spending less than two hours of actual time far less work as much of the time was him on the Cell phone.

resp.text: Mr. Solomon, in response to your review I would like to apologize for your unsatisfactory experience with our company.  I would also like to state that we did not install the plumbing originally in your home in 2007.  We thank you for your comment about our courteous service manager calling and setting up your appointment.  We always offer an estimate for the cost of the repairs before any work is conducted, which you approved and paid for the work performed.   We do offer military, senior citizen, and all local law enforcement discounts, if we are informed ahead of time we can most certainly add that discount to your invoice.

name: Phyllis Cox
text: They are honest and reliable.

name: me to you
text:
Update:  7 Dec 2020.  After a year of begging Alms Pump to come reconnect the electric wires in the older pump house that they disconnected to put a check valve,  I had to hire an electrician ($126) to come restore electricity in the pump house so that the lights could be turned on for freezing weather that was 2 days after the 2 days of freezing weather.  The bulb receptacle that was removed without my permission was bought and remounted as the backup bulb.
It makes no sense to mistreat a customer who is a disabled Army Veteran and have been a loyal paying customer.

Buyer beware

Alms pump does not care about their customers.  You cannot trust them to do the job right especially if you leave them and trust that they will do right by you.   I paid $450 for a check valve but the aggravation they caused me for a year to reconnect the electric wires they disabled, removed a light bulb socket without my permission, and had leaking pipes at the new pump, I should charge them $500 or more.

So, buyer beware.
*********************************
Nov 10, 2020 update:
Alm Pump finally came to fix the leaking pipes..  Hurricane Sally busted the leaking pipes open and water was pumped on the grounds for 2 to 3 days and nights. It could have burned up the new pump. I wondered why there were 4 inches of water on the ground 3 days after the hurricane. Wading through the water, I discovered the pump gushing water from the pipe at the pump.  I shut off the power to the pump. Then called Alms Pump.
Their reply was that they had people without water and it would be a couple of days. Well, about 6 weeks later Alms Pump showed up and fixed the pipes to the pump and turned the water back on.  The bill for that meter where no water was used was $60.  This was the first bill where payment was only for water used plus taxes.
As to the older pump, Alms Pump  never went to the  pump house of the older pump and never reconnect the electric wires they disconnected to bring the pump and pipes out of the ground to put a new check valve on the pipe of the older pump.
I have begged Alms Pump to reconnect the wires in the pump house so that the electric plugs can be used to run extension cord to where 2 junipers fell in the yard and need cutting.  To this day, Nov 10, 2020, the 2 juniper are still down.
There is no electricity to the switch for the light bulb when freezing weather comes.

My attorney wrote Alms Pump  a letter and it was ignored.  I gave Alms Pump until 31 Oct 2020 to reconnect the electric wires and that was ignored.

They will not answer as to why they will not reconnect the electric wires they disconnected.  I paid Alms Pump $450 for repairing the older pump (putting in a new check valve).
If I have to hire an electrician to reconnect the wires Alms Pump disconnected, would that make Alms Pumps liable for the payment? My attorney says yes, and, they should be taken to Small Claims Court.

The senior Alms who started Alms Pump never mistreated their customers as I have been grossly mistreated by this younger generation running Allms Pump.

I will never call Alms Pump to put down another well and pump. Fini.

Previous post in Sep 2020:
Not responding to fix the leaking T under the valve they installed.  I have done business with Alms Pump for over 30 years and do not understand why they are not responding to come fix their work. A plumber would not touch it.

Alms Pump. Please come fix your work.

name: John White
text: I would NOT recommend Eagle Service for plumbing. They replaced a portion of our sewer pipe in our basement that we had been having clogging issues with. The new piping looks excellent and the problem seems to have been fixed. However... I had a couple of issues. They charged me an extra $150 for a 2nd visit that only took 10 minutes for him to confirm the issue (I believe this was refunded after I complained). And worst of all, he did not protect the work area and raw sewage dumped all over our washer and dryer, mop sink, basement walls, etc. I did not see this happen and it ended up being much worse than I thought. I asked him if he was going to clean up before he left, he didn't even sweep up the PVC dust from cutting the pipe. He asked me if I had a mop?? All he did was hose down the area and did NOT do a thorough job cleaning up the raw sewage or disinfecting the area. When I called the office to talk to a manager, they told me they have gotten calls before but that it was not standard for their crew to carry cleaning supplies on their trucks. They did not offer to send someone to clean up the mess. The Servpro quote was twice as much as the plumbing quote. I truly cannot believe they would leave someone's home in such a mess. It's a good thing it was in an unfinished basement!

name: Susan Johnson
text: My furnace quit working the day before a predicted freeze warning! I called OnTime Service and they actually told me that the first available appointment was December 9th.  So I got in touch with Eagle Service Company and David was here the same morning I called. This company is a fourth generation company founded in 1930. John Jeffcoat, the owner, was actually an Eagle Scout and his core values are based on what he learned as a Boy Scout!! David found the problem, replaced the broken part, and heat began to blow! He was professional, knowledgeable, and efficient! If I could give more stars I would! ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

name: Nicky Hobbs
text: Eagle Service Company was dispatched to our home to find an exterior leak and restore our water service.  Their people were very courteous and diligent.  They located the source of my leak, evaluated the best way to restore my service and completely repaired everything.  The best thing I like about Eagle is they take ownership.  I knew they were going to be with me from start to finish to make sure I was happy and extremely satisfied, which I am.  Very well done!  They get my highest recommendation.

name: Johnny Segal
text: I called Eagle on a Friday afternoon since we had a drain problem before a busy weekend at my Laundromat. Brian showed up a couple hours later and saved our weekend business. Today Brian came back cleared another drain and jetted all lines. He was very professional, efficient and arrive on time. I think there prices are very fair and would recommend the company and Brian for your pumbling needs.

name: Terry Bost
text: Eagle Service Company came to my home on 7/13/2020 to install a dishwasher, sink, faucet, and disposal. They left and they had damaged the wiring to the dishwasher and it would not run. The company told me the next day to read the user’s manual and call an appliance repair company to come fix it. There is a 28 day warranty on their work. They damaged the wiring to the dishwasher, and I now have to call an electrician to come fix their damage.

resp.text: We installed an owner furnished dishwasher and reconnected the existing electrical wiring.  When we returned to see why the dishwasher had stopped working, we discovered a loose wire in the junction box below the dishwasher.  The dishwasher was operating properly when we left.  We offered to pay to have the homeowner's electrician look at the wiring and correct the existing electrical connection if necessary.  We apologize for the inconvenience.

name: J H
text:
JL Wright did a total re-plumb on my older house, which had galvanized pipes.
The good:
- They were professional, dependable and honest.
- Their pricing was fair and good.
- They replaced all of my drains and my water lines for less than one of their competitors wanted just to replace my water lines.
- They also saved me over $1000 by NOT replacing a perfectly good PVC water line (they dug a small hole to it to show me it was good) from the meter to my house. (Another company told me that line was galvanized and required replacement.)
The bad:
- Brion got a back injury that slowed down the job by about a day (BUT they didn't charge me for installing frost-proof outside faucets, which cost extra, I think to compensate, and they were back every day until the job was finished).

text: We had a drain that was clogged on one end of the house (the kitchen end) which wasn't affecting the bathrooms. When I called, I was told that he could come after hours at a higher rate or he could come at 2 the next day. I was fine with 2 the next day, but much to my surprise, he was there at around 9:30 that morning! I wasn't home at the time, but my wife sent me a message that he was there, so I went home. He was pretty much done by the time I got there, but I did some tests to make sure everything was draining properly as he packed up his tools. He emailed me an invoice on the spot, and he was off to the next job! I will definitely use them again if I have plumbing issues!

text: Came out on a rainy night around 9 pm to fix a busted pipe at my water pump. Got it done in 15 minutes. No problems since.  I will be using them again. I was very pleased and they are reasonably priced.

name: Molly Richardson
text: David was so so helpful when we had issues with our disposal and main drain line 2 weeks after buying a house! He fixed the problem quickly and gave us great advice for how to prevent it from happening again. We will definitely use them again!

name: Erin Rubin
text: I made a claim through my Home Warranty and was given David’s Business. He called me on Friday to set up an apt for that coming Monday with a time frame of 12-4. I got a call on Monday at 3:30 saying he wouldn’t be able to make it and would put me on the schedule for the next day. Tuesday at 3:30, I still had not heard from him so I called to see what time he was planning on coming. He told me he would not be able to come again on Tuesday and would try for Wednesday. He told me that his builders come first because that’s how he makes his money. If your looking for a plumber that is professional and meets the customers needs in a timely manner then look elsewhere .

name: omar newsome
text: Mr. David was amazing! Problems that no one else seemed to be able to or just didn’t want to fix, he got them done! Great customer service! All around great guy! I Highly recommend David to get them done for you.

resp.text: Thank you Mr Newsome

name: Brandi
text: What I like about David .. He is honest and upfront about what the job requires, and he always does the job right I know this first hand!! I promise you won’t be disappointed! You will be very satisfied! He is easy to talk to and very comfortable to be around ❤️

name: Kate Guthrie
text: My experience with David was excellent. He was able to assess the problem quickly and confidently, and he fixed our issue right away. If future issues arise, I'll be sure to call on this company and request David again.

text: Our septic backed up on Thursday morning & Roto-Rooter had a service technician out to our house by 9AM the following morning on Friday! From the initial phone calling to our service tech showing up, everything ran so smoothly. Matthew Lawrence was our service tech & he was absolutely awesome to work with!!!!! He explained everything he was doing so that I could understand, he was open to any questions I had & was super polite and professional. He pumped out our septic tank and made this pregnant woman's life much much better now that we can use our toilets again!!! THANK YOU AGAIN MATT!!! You ROCK!!! :-)

I’ve used Rotor Rooter for several years at my Restaurant and home. The Technicians are always courteous, respectful, informative and friendly. They treated my home and plumbing issue as if it were their home and issue. They assured their work and even returned to make sure that the problem was not still occurring.
Keep up the excellence in your professionalism.

name: LeShae Skinner

He answered all of my questions confidently. He even told me about the weeds in my yard and how to get rid of them (we're from the north). Highly recommend!

text: If there was a minus rating I would give Mr Kevin Patrick a - 10,he is the most unprofessional plumber I have ever seen and we have built 3 houses, he never shows up when he says he is, he's slow,  messy and a liar, he needs to take that grace plumbing sign off his truck and the Christian cross cos he is a joke, he cleaned out his truck in my yard twice filling up my garbage can to over flowing and I had to clean it out so I could put my own garbage in it, then he got his worker to clean out his whole back seat on another occasion and filled a trash can up again and dropped bolts and screws all in my yard, I ended up with a flat tire and with a cost of over $200 and when I confronted him about it he pretty much called me a liar saying his worker just moved some stuff around, and I told him that I watched his worker do it, he just walked off, then he stained up my concrete with sauntering and drinks after I visibly posted signs at every entry stating no food or drinks because we are staining the floors, he has no regard to his customers, I have  fired him and he has threatened to put a lean on my house, bring it on Mr Patrick cos I have so much more that I didn't put on your review

text: BAAAAAAADDD COMPANY! If you want work done wrong and by an unlicensed contractor named Kevin then this is the company for you. Kevin seemed to be knowledgeable and honest. They made him stop work in the middle of the process. Not only do I have a botched job, I have incomplete inaccurate work, fines from the county and health department. Kevin does not care. He is a conartist scammer. So do not waste your time or money. He claims to be a man of God but remember the devil was once first an angel! This has been the worse experience of my life. I'm out of money, time and most of all patience. This company is TERRIBLE. YoU WILL BE SORRY IF YOU CHOOSE THIS COMPANY. KEVIN IS A CONARTIST!!!!! Beware

text: Had them come out and do a spring inspection on my system. They were quick, direct and progressional. Inspected everything to a T. Found a coil leak that would have given us problems this summer and patched the leak then and there. They are my go to.

name: Paula
text: Furnace not working, called, Craig called back promptly, arrived shortly thereafter.  Diagnosed & fixed problem, price very reasonable.  Will use Stability Mechanical again and plan to recommend them to anyone who will listen!

name: james borders
text: Great food cooked by Dillion one mean meat loaf

name: Dodi Heard
text:
Google Rating
4.9
Based on 40 reviews
Facebook Rating
5.0
Based on 48 reviews

Highly Recommended!

Our both our heat and air went out at the same time this Winter, and having Lupus and Raynaud's disease (causes some areas of my body such as your fingers and toes to feel numb and cold in the slightest of cool environments), it became very uncomfortable very fast.

Having been in customer service for over 25yrs, I consider customer service experience a "deal" or "deal-breaker" from the moment a representative greets me. A representative (Chris) arrived early the next morning, and with a smile no less! He was very knowledgeable about various products, professional (masked and wearing shoe covers), patient and caring about our situation. He assured me that Stability Mechanical would exhaust every option to assist us, and that's just what they did! Not only did he and "Kam" (in office rep) work hard together to get us financed, but the actual owner briefly joined them on the phone and encouraged them to work with our budget to at least get the "heat" working. It was then, that I knew we had the best of Birmingham! But, that was not all. They were able to get us financed for and entire new HVAC Unit within our budget!

Daniel and Drew were both very pleasant and very knowledgeable, as they answered every question I had. Together they installed a new HVAC unit in our home on Friday. Based on my experience with Stability Mechanical, the above ratings are accurate!  Thank you (Chris, Kam, Daniel, Drew, Turk and of course Joe).

name: Mindy Moore
text: This company is exceptional in service, quality, and follow-up.  We have had a hiccup or two but it was mostly due to the way the house is built.  Joe, the owner, came out and made sure that EVERYTHING was great!!!  Would recommend to everyone looking for ac work.

name: Leelee Gaissert
text: Chris was very polite and knowledgeable he explained everything we would be needing in detail.

name: Kelsey Rocco
text: We received quotes from several other plumbing companies. Stability beat all of them and fixed our problem in 15 min. Will definitely call them again if we have any other problems.

name: Katie Broach
text:
My husband and I have used Stability on multiple occasions. Every time they come out to our house it's nothing but a wonderful experience. Tylor and Craig installed a new hot water heater tonight and they were so awesome.
I am the type of person that has to watch and ask questions. They both were very patient and answered my questions throughly. Highly recommend giving them a call if you ever have a problem!! Thanks guys!! Y'all were great!!!

name: botcwc1
text: Honest guys that do great work. Definitely able to diagnose the issue and take care of it quickly. Very satisfied will use them again :-)

name: Leigh Davis
text: Stability provides excellent service with professional, knowledgeable service people. I would recommend them for all of you heating/AC needs. Very reasonable prices and quality work. My family would not even consider using any other company.

name: Christie Estes
text: No homeowner wants to come home to find that the AC isn't working. Particularly not in June in Alabama. Last year, my upstairs AC unit went out.  The guys from Stability came out promptly and evaluated the situation. They explained why I needed a new unit. They also explained why it made more financial sense to go ahead and replace the unit. They could have suggested putting a band aid on it for a temporary fix only to have to ultimately replace it. And that might have worked--maybe even a few times. And it would have been profitable for them to "fix" it a few times before replacing the unit. However, these guys are honest and ethical. If you don't need it, it will not be suggested. I was able to get a nicer unit than what I had for a reasonable price that is far more energy efficient than what I had. It was also nice to do business with a local company. When you call, you get to speak to an actual person. The Stability guys will show up on time and get the job done promptly. They are polite and courteous as well. I would recommend them to anyone!

name: Gabriella Satterberg
text:
Our AC went out 2 days after coming home with a newborn. We called Joe and his team and they were able to come out and troubleshoot the issue. They then went out of their way to track down and go pick up the part needed so they could fix the issue that day rather than order and wait for it to come in.
I definitely recommend them for your HVAC needs!

name: Beth Nixon
text: I highly recommend Stability to anyone needing service, repairs or a new unit. They had the best prices of everyone that I contacted, they are extremely professional and make you feel like family. If you want the BEST prices and service, please call Stability because I promise you will not be disappointed!!

text: Quick, professional and reasonably priced. What more do you need??!!

name: Don Frezell
text:
Had a Tune up done on my 23 yr. Old Trane unit and asked for a estimate on a new larger system. Tech did all the measurements and told me they would get back by email with some options. Never heard a word back. Ended up getting estimate from Country Boyz and 3D Air that I received the same day. 3D AIR INSTALLED a new system 2 days later. I had heard good things about Stability Mechanical and was ready to buy from them but they dropped the ball on this sale!

Thank you for replying.

name: Selena Harrison
text:
Stability Mechanical will take care of your HVAC needs. They are fast and thorough HVAC experts.

Our system was not cooling properly right when high temps hit. Joe and his team were at our house within a couple of hours and presented THREE solutions. We have not had one problem since they came out and now rest assured everything will be in working order as the seasons change with their service agreement.

Do not hesitate to call Stability Mechanical for all your HVAC, plumbing and gas services!

name: Dee
text: Very prompt service and very professional.  I would definitely recommend them.

name: Jen G
text: Quick service and reasonable price.  Thanks much!

name: Sl McK
text:
We have home warranty through American Home Shield. Of course they sent Myers, (which we've never had a good experience with Myers)  to inform us we needed a new coil and some freon. We knew our coil was covered and then the freon that was not covered by AHS was estimated about $125. AHS called us, Myers sent in we also needed to have a total duct work adjustment which was $890 not covered by warranty. Myers never told us about needing a complete duct work adjustment.

I call Stability Mechanical​ after hearing great reviews for a second opinion. Next day they were here and gave us a free inspection. Yes, we needed the coil and freon, but not a total duct work adjustment. They were back in two days and had the air fixed quickly. I will add, they were able to fix the air that day, but I needed to file a form with AHS to get a very little partial reimbursed.

We have not had one problems with the air since then. What we were going to be out of pocket having what home warranty did not cover was the same amount we paid Stability Mechanical. This was a realization to us  paying $60 a month for AHS warranty and a $75 service fee was a rip off.

Joe, the owner of Stability Mechanical could not have been nicer, as well as his employees. We are not from this area, so it was so GREAT to find a company that was honest in telling us what exactly we needed, and not adding things we didn't need. I will never use another company for our AC/Heat issues.

name: Kathleen Claybrook
text: Great company!  Rescued us from a leaking water heater!

name: Susan Kaplan
text: I called Keith The Plumber based on local neighborhood reviews. Dennis was very intuitive and listened. He went the extra step to ensure all my plumbing needs were taken care of and that I understood what was going on with my controlled pressure coming from the main water supply plus how it effects my entire house. I did not need a new h2o tank yet, my expansion tank was not working. Plus my leaking faucets got new interior stems and are working like new! Great experience and will refer Keith The Plumber in Dunnavant Valley as well as metro Bham and Shelby County.

name: Charlie Williams
text: I called Keith the Plumber on a Sunday with a blockage in the main sewer line between my house and the street and water backing up.  An actual person answered the phone and said that Keith would call us shortly.  We received a return phone call within 5 minutes to advise us that their plumber Patrick would be at our home within the hour.  Patrick was on time, professional, and quick to assess the problem.  Less than 10 minutes later the problem was solved and disaster was avoided.  I was very pleased with the service we received.  If something like this should happen again in the future, my first call will be to Keith the Plumber.  Yours should be too.

name: dierdriu
text:
I am so impressed with this company.  I had a significant leak. Another plumber had given me a quote over the phone for finding the leak that I could not possibly have afforded.  I found Keith the Plumber on a Google search and gave them a call.  Wes answered my call and told me that they were booked up for the day; they'd come the next day, but they'd put me on a call list in case they finished early.  And, they did.  Roger came out and immediately assessed the situation and began digging for the leaking part. He had it fixed in no time.  Everyone I have spoken to at this company, either live or over the phone, has been exceptionally courteous.

I am a single mother raising three children alone.  I just paid the funeral expenses for my father out of pocket.  There is not a lot of cash lying about at this time, and the issue with our plumbing was a humongous stressor on top of my father's loss and funeral expenses.  I can't begin to express how profoundly touched I was to encounter people who were kind, honest, and beyond reasonable.  I am not ashamed to say that I cried happy tears when I walked into my home and could run water without worrying about the leak and the rising water bill.  I will happily call on this company again when need arises, and I will be glad to recommend them to others.

name: Jennifer Templin
text: Wes along with every single technician I have had the pleasure of working with have been extremely professional, prompt and fair with their pricing. I am an HOA property manager and have used Keith the Plumber for many different types of jobs at many different communities I manage. They do a great job explaining what the issue is and correcting it in a timely manner. I highly recommend!

name: Jennifer P
text: Absolutely DO NOT use them unless you are willing to have them come out multiple times to fix more issues caused by them. I called them out for changing out my tub faucets, which led to multiples call backs to fix leaks outside the tub. I now have damage to my subflooring and vents and my car, that is parked directly under the plumbing.  Each time I was told 'everything is ok but would discover a new issue related to their work!

name: Kimberly Thompson
text: I can't say enough about their excellent service. Speedy, professional, knowledgeable, and fair pricing. I will never call anyone else but this company for my plumbing needs. From my initial phone call to completion of service, everything was handled in a 3-4 hour time frame. Roger and Patrick are consummate professionals who diagnosed our plumbing issues quickly and repaired everything without delay or difficulty. I highly recommend.

name: Jessica C.
text: Trust me, just call them and be done calling folks! I called them about 3pm as I saw water flowing through my yard. They asked if I had water, to which I told them no that I had cut it off.  I told them I could make it until morning if needed and they asked to call me back, had already heard this from several places but no one called back for several hours later....within 30 minutes I not only had a call back, but it was worked out to have someone here that day! Then, not only did they fixed the leak at hand...they tested the pressure and found a faulty pressure regulator to be the culprit and fixed the root of the problem for me. I cannot say enough great stuff about their honesty, professionalism and work ethic for treating customers like they would want to be treated!

name: Sheldon Haygood
text: They went above and beyond to take care of repairs.  Communicating every step and finishing the job in a professional and timely matter

name: Taisha Davis
text: These guys are awesome and fast. Call and the same day service was done. Yeah u got plumbing issues call Keith The Plumber

name: bonnie smith
text:
These are great guys doing a professional job.  I will definitely be using them again and would recommend them also.

Thank you so much for your prompt professional service.

Bonnie

name: Tracey Fahey
text: Dennis came out and serviced our issue with our water heater today. EXQUISITE customer service. He explained it all to me and works quickly! I’m happy to recommend this company to others and give praise to hard working master plumbers like Dennis, thank you Keith the plumber!

name: Anne Stephens
text:
I had a leaking bathroom faucet and they charged me $175  ($225 including service fee) to change a $2 rubber gasket on a stem. They quoted me the price before even diagnosing the issue, stating, "we can make this stop dripping for $175". It was a 20 minute repair job and it did not solve the problem - still leaked. I requested them to come back because it wasn't fixed and all they did was the exact same repair. This did nothing, and the faucet still leaks to this day. The plumbers were not professional, did not wear masks, and did not want to take the time to accurately diagnose and fix the issue. Instead, they looked for the easiest and quickest "fix".  I ended up having to call another plumber who was able to correctly diagnose and explain the problem to me. I might as well have thrown $225 in the trash.

Not only did the plumber waste my money, but cost me HUNDREDS. During my initial request for service, I also requested that they re-install a center knob on a shower spa sprayer that came loose. It was installed a few years ago, and nothing technically was wrong with it - the center knob just needed to be re-installed. After taking apart the cover plate and fooling with it, they said it couldn't be fixed. They never diagnosed the issue or told me what was wrong with it, offering no solution. I hired a different plumber to look at it today and he said that the metal lip on the center valve is chipped and broken from someone trying to turn it excessively to remove it (it is one piece and can't be removed). It was installed a few years ago, and no one else has fooled with it except for them. So, they chipped it when fooling with it, which explains their reluctance to fix the problem. Now the entire unit has to be replaced, I have to cut a hole in my wall, and it is going to cost me hundreds of dollars. An honest or reliable plumber would have owned up to the mistake instead of trying to brush it off, and a knowledgeable one would have known better to begin with.

I honestly never leave bad reviews. I just think that other people should be warned before dealing with this company.

name: Mike Sumner
text: I have used Keith Plumbing twice.  I have been so please with them.  Tony was great.  Will use them again.

name: Bob Barker
text:
These are the best plumbers I've ever had! Wes was great to work with and the technician was great! I could not be happier with the results and the great attitude they had.

They helped me out when my home warranty failed to send a competent plumber out so I gave Kieth The Plumber a call and they came out the SAME day I made the phone call. They got the work done quickly and efficiently. Happy customer and will use them for all my plumbing needs!

text: Excellent service.  Excellent work.

Would have saved me money in the long run going with these guys first.  Lesson learned!

That is a  good thing to do to keep the customer aware of when they will arrive. I recommend Keith the Plumber and will use them again.

text: We’ve used them twice now for two separate plumbing issues. Both times they were extremely professional and did a great job. Only plumbers we will ever use!

resp.text: Hi Mr. Cook, could you please let us know the service address of the work performed so we can see what happened.  We can't find your invoice, nor we have any record of service for you, but we would love to know what went wrong, and how we can correct it.

name: Elex Harris
text: I had a DIFFERENT reputable company come to fix a leaking bathtub faucet, and they ended up quoting me $1300 and at least 5 hours of work to fix it on top of their $80 dispatch fee. What they told me didn't make sense and the price seemed way too high. I tried calling 2 different plumbing services to get a second opinion and couldn't get on the line with an actual plumber. Finally I called Keith the Plumber, and within 10 minutes, I was on the phone with Keith himself.  He was extremely nice and helpful. They came out the next day, and had the faucet repaired with all new valve stems and handles in under 45 minutes. They also charged me less than a 1/4 of what the other company quoted. I'll be using this company for any future plumbing services I need, and I highly recommend them for anyone searching for a plumber.

name: Tom Stanford
text: Excellent work! 6 stars out of 5! Down home old fashion service! Even wore those doctor things over their boots when they came thru my home! I felt like royalty! Thanks Keith

name: Jade Sisk-trott
text: The plumbers were fast and very professional. They explained the issues with our well and fixed it. The office personnel where very patient and professional as well. Would recommend.

name: Fallon Bresseale
text: These guys are awesome!!! They came out to my house and fixed my horrible situation within hours!!! Would highly recommend!!

name: MICHAEL HENLEY
text: Came on a Saturday when our water heater went late in the day.  Explained things to me.  Replaced our water heater with a larger one (they did not have the smaller one with them), charging only the cost of the smaller one (so we wouldn't have to wait for another day or two, since it was at night), did NOT charge for the weekend trip charge. Saved us hundreds of dollars !!  They were very polite, very professional.  Did a GREAT job!   Arranged for us to pay over time (12 months, no interest).    Installed COMMERCIAL grade equipment!  Handled everything.  THIS is the way a quality company should be run !  I highly recommend them.

name: Curtis Brown
text: This is the second time I have used this company.  The first time was a little over a month ago for a clogged toilet. Very nice and thought they fixed problem. Called them again this past Sunday to tell them same problem again with the same toilet. The guy that answered the phone at 9:30 am was Wes, he said they were closed and seemed irritated that I would call on a Sunday even though I was looking at my receipt which stated “24 hours”.  Needless to say he was not helpful at all and I have since had a different plumber come to fix the problem. My advice would be to not use these guys especially on a Sunday or you can get the wrath of Wes. I was so offended by him that this is the only time I have ever left negative feedback on somebody.

name: Tonia Dyas
text: Way to expensive for me. Very friendly people that cane out

name: Heather Norwood
text: Moved and installed new water heater then replaced shower fixtures. Everyone was Very polite,on time, clean and fairly priced!

name: Myra Fabian
text: I cannot say enough how fortunate we are to have been referred to these guys. We had a minor crisis over the Christmas holidays - our son's gas heater regulator blew and the gas company cut off his gas until he could get it fixed. We called Keith the Plumber and actually got Keith himself on the Sunday before Christmas. He arranged for one of his techs, Bobby, to make the trip to the house, and he followed up throughout the day to check the status and advise of how to deal with the gas company. On Christmas Eve, Bobby met the gas company for us to make sure the cut-on went smoothly. Keith again followed up to let us know. He seemed genuinely concerned that my grandchildren's home have heat for Christmas. So - thank you, Keith and Bobby and all who worked behind the scenes, for making this bad situation a whole lot "less bad" than it could have been. You guys have our loyalty.

name: Jim Kelpner
text: Everytime I've called Keith the Plumber he has done amazing work and shows up on time!!!!!! Thats Huge!!!!!!  6 stars out of 5

name: Jay Ellett

text: WyattWorks did a fantastic job replacing 3 toilets in our house while installing "slow close" lids. The work was done seamlessly and there wasn't any "hassling" or "up-selling" during the process. Smooth and efficient! I highly recommend them for your plumbing needs.

text: Jim and  Wesley of Morrison Plumbing responded to my need for toilet repair promptly.  I was so happy to see them show at my door after I contacted them. I highly recommend them for your plumbing needs.

text:
THESE GUYS ARE THE ABSOLUTE BEST!!!! I highly highly highly recommend this company for any plumbing issues. From start to finish, they told us what they would do to fix our problem and they actually went above and beyond in order to do that. We had contacted our usual plumber about our issue before the shut down and we still haven’t heard from him. Also, every job took him at least a month to get the needed part and back out to our house.
***Morrison Plumbing  took ONE hour to complete the job.... and that included going to pick up parts for a discontinued faucet!!

name: Thomas Treuil
text: Quick, dependable service.

name: Michael Irwin
text: I highly recommend Morrison Plumbing for their quick response, highly skilled plumbers and reasonable rates. These guys don’t mess around. They get the job done and they get you back to living your life without having to worry about water on the floor or in the walls! And they’re just down-to-earth good people.

text: This company was very professional from start to finish - I got a call to notify me when the plumbers were on their way, and they arrived right on time. name: Paxton Osborne
text: Great company. Fast response. Honest. Great job and quick.

We will be using them for all our plumbing needs.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the kind words and for taking the time to do this review for us! Tim is definitely an asset to our team!

name: Beverly McCutcheon
text:
TRAVIS, I got the best finally. Gave up, looked for Gutter Repair. 8 years of misery with Gutter Company that installed never could fix. Same areas. Travis has been here several times repairs and so much more. More then I can say this man has done.Truly needed him years ago. Stopped all the problems I have had for 8 years with leaking gutters, A nightmare for me. I feel rescued. Has been so great I could never say enough about him. A really nice man too I got know well as I was out there with him showing me what was wrong and needed. So where would I be now without Travis. Another person or new gutters? First day he came I was horrified what he found. Asked him do I just need new gutters again, was worried then about the whole house. He said no, he was repairing them, I needed to see what was wrong, those areas. Travis saved me a lot money and stress I have been through with the thought of new gutters and couldn’t be repaired. I will always use him.
I see now here too maybe he can clean them. Had no
Idea all the other things this company can do. Will be helpful for me too. All the great reviews and I have just gotten one of them, Travis. Must be just like him.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your review! We are very pleased that you were happy with Travis and will pass that along to him!!

name: Devon Rankin
text: Hired BFP to install screens for my existing back porch. Blake contacted me the day after I submitted my request to talk through it. We communicated via text and phone after as questions came up and then Blake put together a detailed scope for the work and made great suggestions for materials to use for the job. We ran into problems sourcing the materials (very high demand!), but he kept me informed of the delay along the way and was able to begin work as soon as we had what we needed. Work was performed over a 3 day period, and Blake showed up on time and worked diligently each day. He kept me updated on his progress during the day and the end product turned out great. We can't wait to start using our newly screened porch.

resp.text: Thank you so much Devon!  We are so pleased that everything went well and will happily share your kind works with Blake!

name: Lawrence Sheffield
text: BFR is the best in the business! I wish I called them sooner. Thanks Seth and Gibbs.

name: Bryan Ramsey
text: About a month ago I had posted a negative review about Birmingham Fast Repair, and I'm here to say that I was WRONG!!! They were quick to respond in the most professional manner to my complaint. Seth made this matter his top concern, which every customer would want. This just goes to show the quality of customer service this group has. Seth was very apologetic (which he did not need to be) and did a fantastic job on installing my french patio doors. Seth was such a pleasure to be around. Not only was he professional, but he took time to get to know me and my family, which went beyond my expectations. His work and craftsmanship were very impressive. He definitely knows his work and set the bar very high. I could write this review all day on how pleased we were to have him in our home and his work product. I feel like I have finally found a company that I can trust to do an Honest, and PROFESSIONAL job at an unbeatable price. Seth's work has transformed our home beyond what we thought it could look like. I would highly recommend SETH and Birmingham Fast Repair for all of your projects. They will definitely be my "go-to" company for future projects.

resp.text: Thank you so much Bryan!  We really value our customers and appreciate that you took time to write this review for us.  We are so pleased that you were happy with the work Seth did for you and very grateful that you gave us a second chance! Please call us again any time!

name: Madison Williamson
text: We have used this company twice now- for building our deck, building our fence, and staining our deck! Great value, great quality, and very friendly staff!

name: Michael Forester
text: Gibbs, from bham fast repair, repaired a fence that was damaged from Zeta. I couldn’t get any companies to call back because everyone was busy because of the storm. Very efficient way to handle work especially since I couldn’t even get a return call from others. We worked out the details and it was repaired within a  week or so. He saved us money on supplies and followed through on everything he said he would do. He was even early to my house to start the repairs. No surprise charges either. Very impressive individual and company. If I ever need any other odd jobs done, I’ll definitely reach out to Gibbs and Birmingham Fast Repair

name: Sheena W
text: It was a pleasure working with Chris. I live out of state and own a 4 plex. One of the units were vacant and needed some paint/drywall work before being put back on the market. Chris was quick in contacting me, quick to start and complete the job and great at maintaining constant communication throughout the project. He was very willing to go above and beyond in assisting me. He provided before and after pictures and a walk through video explaining everything so I could be comfortable with his work. I can't physically be there, so he was my eyes and brought unknown issues to my attention, which he verified with pictures. I have a property management company, but their bids were high to do some of this work, which is why I shopped around and found Birmingham Fast Repair.  They also didn't catch some of the issues Chris did. My experience leads me to believe that Chris is nothing short of honest, knowledgeable, trustworthy, and hardworking. Highly recommended.

name: Joe Walker

And to boot, he charged $100.00 less than the quote. He was that fast! The work looks great. I told him that I will definitely use them again in the future.

text: Stephen has been to our house on a couple of projects and I can’t brag enough on him. He’s got great ideas and does fast, neat work. text: I had a gutter that drained poorly on top of our exit stairs. Travis came on time, very polite, did a fast accurate professional job and charged half the quote. WOW that was great. text: We had our porch stairs down and I submitted a request online. Blake quickly responded and scheduled time. he came exactly on the time he promised and estimated the work. From there he went to the squeak in the kitchen floor.  Fixed!  We needed new lattice panels on an outside storage closet.  Done!  Life is so much easier because of  Kyle and Birmingham Fast Repair.

text: This is a hidden gem of a home repair service. The variety of work they're able to do is so wonderful! I really appreciate their timeliness and professionalism with each repair.

text: Luis did a great job on the handyman tasks we've given him. He started on a fence repair and has done a number of other things around the house from painting to plumbing. Seth Corbin is also a good guy. Highly recommended.

text: Tim did great work cleaning and repairing our gutters, and came out within an hour of our initial phone call. Great communication and will be happy to hire again.

name: John Willard
text: Birmingham fast repair was so great to work with. Seth and his crew efficiently fixed the problems that we faced. Can’t wait to use BHM fast repair again.

name: Bryan Ramsey
text: It took about a month for someone to come out to do measurements (started the 2nd week of March). I was told I would be contacted 2 weeks later for an install. I understand this happened at the beginning of the COVID-19 situation and is a hard time for all of us, but I had not received any other communication or follow up from anyone. I had sent text messages on 2 occassions (a month after measurments) and no response. I'm not sure what its like in this line of work, but I was willing to spend close to $3K on the project and not a peep from anyone. This may not seem like a lot of money in this line of work, but $3K for a day or two of work I would be running to complete this job. I'm  concerned about the lack of follow-thru in communication. There are plenty of people that need work and it's disappointing to see the lack of interest.

resp.text: Bryan, I appreciate the feedback. Obviously we missed the mark on this one and I sincerely apologize. I’ll certainly look into what went wrong and make the necessary adjustments to prevent this from happening again!

name: Grace Willis
text:
Couldn't recommend anyone better! (Ask for Ethan!)

I called Birmingham Fast Repair to book a quote and possible appointment to install a pedicure chair's foot rest at my job. They were very fast and informative to book someone for us. They sent an email with a name/photo/bio/contact of who the handyman would be. He followed up the day before and day of (before the appointment).

Upon arrival he was prepared and friendly. He assessed the parts/chair and confidently installed everything exactly as needed and at a timely manner -- I commend him for agreeing to fix it, especially since he had never worked on a pedi chair (who even has?) and it's fairly complex considering there are water lines and pipes involved. He communicated everything very well.

Thank you for everything. We will definitely be recommending you all to everyone we can!

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words! It means so much!

name: Rebecca Barganier
text: Excellent experience. 10/10, would recommend, will use again!

resp.text: You are too kind! Thank you!

name: FrostByte
text: Did a great job hanging my tv. Was on time, professionally mannered and dressed.

.

name: DANIELLE WILLIAMS
text: APP came out to service my septic tank.  After spending several hours taking the tank apart; they came to the conclusion that the tank malfunctions due to some debris in the tank.  I got a $465 bill to clean debris from the tank.  I assumed this fixed the problem until the next day when I realized my pump wasn't clicking on.  We contacting APP to let them know it wasn't fixed.  Amy then sent us a quote for $1200 to fix the pump.  There is no doubt in my mind we were completely taken advantage of from this company.  I wouldn't recommend or suggest anyone use them for any form of plumbing work.  And I plan to report them to the BBB and anyone else. It's sad when people feel like they can take advantage of you when they know a little bit more about something than you do.  If I could have given them zero stars; I would have.

resp.text: We are terribly sorry you feel this way. We explained to you that even after we pulled the pump, cleaned out the filter, the check valve, and reconnected the float switch and the alarm to their original location in the tank (the pvc had snapped off at some point and this very likely may have caused the pump to run constantly, wearing out the motor). We spent several hours working in and around your septic tank. Plumbing is often a process of elimination, and you understood that there was a good chance the pump may still need to be replaced, however since it was fully functional when we finished you wanted to hold off on the more costly replacement. We stand behind our work, and offered you a credit for half the original invoice to go towards a new pump installation. This offer still stands. We wish you the best going forward. God bless.

name: Erin Nivison
text: I really hate sharing bad reviews but this company deserves one. We had used John Wayne for several other repairs and never had an issue. When we needed help replacing our water filter they were the first company I called.  So we had the big blue filter that’s shown in the picture below and our only issue was we couldn’t get the housing off to replace the filter inside. We tried everything we could and then eventually cracked the housing so it needed to be replaced. I called John Wayne and said I have a big blue water filter and we need help getting it off so we can replace it. They said they’d need to come out and take a look so I said ok. They came out and said they could get the new part in two days. I could order the same part on amazon and get it in a few days but I figured why not just have them order it and replace it so it all gets taken care of at once.  (also note that all of the water in our house runs through this filter so we had to turn off the water and turn it on sporadically to take showers/flush toilets etc and collect the leaking water in tubs). So I don’t hear anything from them on the 2nd day, so I call and ask what’s going on....”oh we’ll call the supplier and find out”. They call the supplier and they promise that it’s “on the truck” and will be here the next day. I don’t hear anything the next day...so I call them again. “Oh let me call the supplier and find out what’s going on”. They call me back and say well I guess it wasn’t in the truck yesterday but they promise it’s there now and we’ll have it tomorrow. Well you can guess what happens, I call them yet again the next day since I haven’t heard from them and they still don’t have the part. I call them again on Friday (note that this started on Monday and we’re still without water) and they said they’d call me back. I call again on Friday and get no answer. We had to leave to go out of town for the weekend and I’m pretty PO’d at this point so I just leave it for Monday. Monday I call them back and they say they’ve finally got the part and they’ll come out and install it. They send some guy out and he installs it while I’m working at home. I take a look and notice that it’s a completely different filter and now they’re charging me for 2 service trips plus this new filter housing and filters. I pay the guy because he has nothing to do with my frustration with this company. I call the office and ask why I’m being charged for a completely different filter that costs $400 (the one we had would’ve cost $65 on amazon). And John Wayne tried to tell me that I told him it was a different filter. YOU HAD SOMEONE COME OUT AND LOOK AT THE FILTER BEFORE IT WAS ORDERED AND CHARGED ME A SERVICE FEE, HOW DID I TELL YOU IT WAS A DIFFERENT FILTER?? (He also asked why i don’t just order it on amazon, and i said because you said it’d be here in two days so i figured you knew what you were talking about) I was irate, this should’ve cost $200 MAX and now I’m having to pay $700. After a very long argument and him telling me that he’ll be more careful to make sure they discuss ordering different parts with the customer in the future he refunded me one of the service trips...totally stupid company, I would not recommend them because they will rip you off!!! (Just take a look at the filters in the picture and tell me how confusing that looks- ITS A BIG BLUE FILTER!!)

text:
My brother and I own a vacation home in Huntsville.  Our Air went out over the summer and what a nightmare!  We called several companies prior to finding The Hutchens Company.  The first company that came out was unprofessional and very expensive.

We then found the Hutchens Company and man what difference.  They were very professional, on time, offered to fix the problem right away however we ended up replacing the equipment.  They started the install the same day and our new unit was operating mid the next morning.

Thanks Hutchens Company, you guys are the best!

text:
Would definitely recommend!  Nicest plumbers and customer service when calling.

Spoke with Leah to setup appointment, very friendly.

Advanced Plumbing Service fixed what Hansen Plumbing screwed up when Hansen replaced partial pipe under our kitchen sink.

Hansen apparently did not use long enough pipe causing it to leak from the slip joint and drain from our garage disposal.

Thank you Advanced Plumbing Service for fixing what Hansen Plumbing could not!!

text: I had an emergency at my house and called Advanced Plumbing, Ron and his guys were there ASAP.  Their level of service and professionalism is unmatched.  They are clean, courteous and skilled.  Highly recommended.
